analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa /

analyzed: sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa 'di las gang zhig byed par 'gyur ba de ni bskal pa brgyar yang de bzhin gshegs pas bstan par mi spyod kyi /

analyzed: gzhan du mdor bsdus nas gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: 'dis skyes bu dam pa de ni sgo mtha' yas pas sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro zhing /
translated: This causes one to follow all sentient beings through infinite doors.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la lhag par dmigs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo sna tshogs pa'i rjes su zhugs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la lhag par dmigs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo sna tshogs pa'i rjes su zhugs pa /
translated: It causes one to enter the various doors of liberation, such as the door of liberation that focuses on all the tathāgatas.

original: sems can 'dul ba'i sbyor ba rnam pa sna tshogs pas gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rtse ba /
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba'i sbyor ba rnam pa sna tshogs pas gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rtse ba /
translated: It causes one to play with the meditative absorption that abides through various kinds of application in training sentient beings.

original: las thams cad rjes su dran pa'i cho ga yang dag par sbyor ba'i gzungs thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: las thams cad rjes su dran pa'i cho ga yang dag par sbyor ba'i gzungs thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: It causes one to attain the dhāraṇī that is the correct application of the rite of recollecting all activities.

original: sems can gyi khams dang / mos pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs sna tshogs pa mngon par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams dang / mos pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs sna tshogs pa mngon par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: It causes one to accomplish various forms that are in accord with the realms of sentient beings and their aspirations.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs kyi stobs dang / stobs sna tshogs mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i sgo sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i mos pas snying po 'di bzlas @274b na gzugs sna tshogs mthong bar 'gyur ro //

translated: the power of the blessings of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and the power of various accomplishments. If one recites this essence mantra with the intention of recollecting the Buddha, one will see various forms.

original: mdor bsdus na /
analyzed: mdor bsdus na /

analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs pa yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will see various world systems where buddhas appear.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor yang sgra 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor yang sgra 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The maṇḍala of the wheel of the Tathāgata’s speech will emit sounds.

original: gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig la sogs pa'i char yang mngon par 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig la sogs pa'i char yang mngon par 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: A rain of gold, jewels, pearls, and so forth will descend.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad du yi dvags rnams la bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung ba yang mngon par rab tu 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad du yi dvags rnams la bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung ba yang mngon par rab tu 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: In all realms of sentient beings, food, drink, and sustenance will descend for the pretas.

original: dmyal ba rnams kyi grang ba la dro ba yang yang dag par skyed par byed do //
analyzed: dmyal ba rnams kyi grang ba la dro ba yang yang dag par skyed par byed do //
translated: He generates warmth in the hells.

original: dud 'gro rnams kyi gcig la gcig za ba'i sdug bsngal yang rab tu zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams kyi gcig la gcig za ba'i sdug bsngal yang rab tu zhi bar byed do //
translated: He pacifies the suffering of the animals who eat each other.

original: sems can mos pa'i sgo sna tshogs pa'i yul can gyi sems can gyi khams rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can mos pa'i sgo sna tshogs pa'i yul can gyi sems can gyi khams rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
translated: He purifies the realms of beings who have various inclinations and objects of interest.

original: byin gyis rlab par byed /🔽yongs su 'gengs par byed //
analyzed: byin gyis rlab par byed / yongs su 'gengs par byed //
translated: He empowers them.🔽He fills them.

original: yongs su smin par byed /🔽rnam par 'dul bar byed /🔽nges par sbyong bar byed /
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed / rnam par 'dul bar byed / nges par sbyong bar byed /
translated: He ripens them.🔽He trains them.

original: rab tu sbyong bar byed /
analyzed: rab tu sbyong bar byed /
translated: He purifies them.

original: rnam par 'phel bar byed /
analyzed: rnam par 'phel bar byed /
translated: He increases them.

original: dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dga' bar byed /
translated: He delights them.

original: so sor 'god par byed /
analyzed: so sor 'god par byed /
translated: He establishes them.

original: rnam par grol bar byed /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar byed /
translated: He liberates them.

original: byang chub kyi theg pa la lhag par 'dzeg par byed myur du lhag par 'dzeg pa'i sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag kyang ston par byed /
analyzed: byang chub kyi theg pa la lhag par 'dzeg par byed myur du lhag par 'dzeg pa'i sa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag kyang ston par byed /
translated: He teaches the instructions of the perfections.

original: mdor na / mthar gyis byang chub la gzhol zhing so sor 'god par byed /
analyzed: mdor na / mthar gyis byang chub la gzhol zhing so sor 'god par byed /
translated: In short, he makes them gradually turn toward awakening and establishes them in it.

original: dge ba @275a *//🔽sgrub pa la gnas pa skyed par byed /
analyzed: dge ba @275a *// sgrub pa la gnas pa skyed par byed /
translated: He causes them to practice virtue.

original: sdug bsngal dang / nyon mongs pa zad par byed /🔽rnam par 'joms par byed /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / nyon mongs pa zad par byed / rnam par 'joms par byed /
translated: He causes them to give rise to the state of abiding in the exhaustion of suffering and afflictions.🔽He causes them to be destroyed.

original: rnam par sel bar byed /
analyzed: rnam par sel bar byed /
translated: He causes them to be removed.

original: 'dren par byed /
analyzed: 'dren par byed /
translated: He causes them to be led.

original: 'joms par byed /
analyzed: 'joms par byed /
translated: He causes them to be destroyed.

original: mdor na / rang gi smon lam gyi stobs dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs kyi stobs kyis sems can gyi khams thams cad du /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa yang byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor na / rang gi smon lam gyi stobs dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs kyi stobs kyis sems can gyi khams thams cad du / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa yang byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In short, by the power of his own aspirations, the power of his merit and wisdom, and the power of the Tathagata's blessings, he performs the deeds of the Tathagata in all realms of sentient beings.

original: 'dir yang sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyis don yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i chog bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyis don yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i chog bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, too, one should explain the ritual for not letting the purpose of suffering sentient beings decline.

original: sngags 'dzin pas dang por re zhig byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: sngags 'dzin pas dang por re zhig byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: First, the mantra holder, a son of good family who has generated the mind of awakening,

original: rigs kyi bu mo byis pa so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs rnyed pa 'di nyid la bdag nyid dad par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo byis pa so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs rnyed pa 'di nyid la bdag nyid dad par bya'o //
translated: “Son of good family, you should have faith in this very stage that transcends the stage of childish ordinary beings and obtains the blessing of the tathāgatas.

original: sgrub pa po rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: sgrub pa po rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: The practitioner, son or daughter of good family,

original: rigs kyi bu mos snga dro dang po la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mos snga dro dang po la /
translated: in the morning,

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad la bdag nyid dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad la bdag nyid dbul bar bya ste /
translated: should offer himself to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas together with their retinues.

original: bdag ming che ge mo zhes bgyi ba chos kyi dbyings su gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad la bdag dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag ming che ge mo zhes bgyi ba chos kyi dbyings su gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad la bdag dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: ‘I, named so-and-so, offer myself to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas together with their retinues who belong to the realm of phenomena.

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa de @275b rnams kyis kyang bdag la rnam pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad du byin gyis brlab pa dang / yongs su bzung bar gyur cig /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa de @275b rnams kyis kyang bdag la rnam pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad du byin gyis brlab pa dang / yongs su bzung bar gyur cig /
translated: May those who possess great compassion also bless me and accept me in every way and at all times.

original: bdag la grub pa dang / mchog stsol cig /
analyzed: bdag la grub pa dang / mchog stsol cig /
translated: Grant me accomplishment and the supreme.

original: de nas sdig pa so sor bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sdig pa so sor bshags par bya ste /
translated: Then one should individually confess the evil.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las skyes pa'i sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags par bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las skyes pa'i sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags par bgyi'o //
translated: One should individually confess all the evil that has been produced from passion, hatred, and folly.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thugs bskyed pa gang gis bshags pa mdzad pa'i sems bskyed pa des bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thugs bskyed pa gang gis bshags pa mdzad pa'i sems bskyed pa des bshags par bya ste /
translated: One should confess with that thought of enlightenment by which the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas have confessed.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen pa ltar des kyang ji tsam du bshags par nus pa de tsam du bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen pa ltar des kyang ji tsam du bshags par nus pa de tsam du bshags par bya'o //
translated: One should confess as much as one is able.

original: de nas bsod nams la rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bsod nams la rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
translated: Then one should rejoice in the merit.

original: gang dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs sems can gyi khams rnam par sbyong bar byed pa /
analyzed: gang dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs sems can gyi khams rnam par sbyong bar byed pa /
translated: One should rejoice in the accumulation of merit of all the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Disciples, and Solitary Buddhas of the three times, which purifies the realms of all sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi khams yongs su srung bar byed pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams yongs su srung bar byed pa /
translated: He should protect the realm of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa de dag thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba bla na med pas rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa de dag thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba bla na med pas rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
translated: He should rejoice in all those mundane and supramundane [virtues] with the highest rejoicing.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpas mkhyen pa ltar des kyang ji ltar rjes su yi rang bar nus pa de ltar rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpas mkhyen pa ltar des kyang ji ltar rjes su yi rang bar nus pa de ltar rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
translated: He should rejoice in them as much as possible, as the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas know.

original: de nas mchod pa'i @276a *//🔽bya ba bya ste /
analyzed: de nas mchod pa'i @276a *// bya ba bya ste /
translated: Then he should perform the rite of worship.🔽He should offer to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas all the worship that he himself and others have performed, are performing, and will perform, in the presence of all the Tathāgatas.🔽He should offer to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas all the worship that is performed by the assemblies of noble disciples and the assemblies of self-awakened ones, in the presence of all the Tathāgatas.🔽He should offer to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas all the worship that is performed by the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, in the presence of all the Tathāgatas.

original: sems can gyi khams na gang nga yir med cing yongs su gzung ba med pa'i mchod pa'i cho ga de thams cad sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mchod pa'i phrin las kyis dbul bar bya'o //

translated: one will become the lord of the perfection of the four continents, practicing the bodhisattva conduct that tames the difficult to tame.

original: sku gdung dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la bzlas pa 'bum byas la nya la 'khor lo'i phyag mtshan nam; rdo rje'i phyag mtshan nam /
analyzed: sku gdung dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la bzlas pa 'bum byas la nya la 'khor lo'i phyag mtshan nam; rdo rje'i phyag mtshan nam /
translated: Having recited one hundred thousand times in front of a stūpa with relics, one should take a wheel-marked seal, a vajra-marked seal,

original: rgyal mtshan blangs nas ji srid 'phur ba de srid bzlas na des kun tu 'gro ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan blangs nas ji srid 'phur ba de srid bzlas na des kun tu 'gro ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: or a victory banner, and recite as long as it flies. By that, one will become a vidyādhara who goes everywhere.

original: chu bor zhugs te bzlas pa 'bum byas nas sa la byas pa'i mchod rten gyi rtsar nya la sogs pa'i nyin zhag la ji skad bshad pa'i gnas su cho ga snga ma bzhin lag pas nor bu blangs te /
analyzed: chu bor zhugs te bzlas pa 'bum byas nas sa la byas pa'i mchod rten gyi rtsar nya la sogs pa'i nyin zhag la ji skad bshad pa'i gnas su cho ga snga ma bzhin lag pas nor bu blangs te /
translated: Having recited one hundred thousand times while entering the water, one should take the jewel with one's hand at the base of a stūpa made of clay, on a day of the new moon, etc., in the previously explained place, according to the former rite.

original: ji srid 'bar bar gyur pa de srid bzlas na yid bzhin gyi nor bu 'chang ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid 'bar bar gyur pa de srid bzlas na yid bzhin gyi nor bu 'chang ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as it blazes, one should recite. One will become a vidyādhara wielding a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: yang de nyid lag pas blangs te bzlas pas yid bzhin gyi nor bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de nyid lag pas blangs te bzlas pas yid bzhin gyi nor bur 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, taking it up with one’s hand, one should recite. It will become a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: zangs ma'i bum pa la chog 'di nyid kyis bsgrub pa byas na bum pa gang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zangs ma'i bum pa la chog 'di nyid kyis bsgrub pa byas na bum pa gang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In a copper pot, one should perform the rite of accomplishment with this very procedure. The pot will be filled.

original: slong mos 'tsho zhing lcags kyi rdo rje lag par blangs te /
analyzed: slong mos 'tsho zhing lcags kyi rdo rje lag par blangs te /
translated: One should take up an iron vajra in one’s hand, and live by begging.

original: ji srid 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar @282a *//
analyzed: ji srid 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar @282a *//
translated: As long as one recites, one will reveal the past, future, and present

original: gyi smra bar bya ba ston par byed pa de srid bzlas pas chos gang nyan par 'dod pa de mngon par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyi smra bar bya ba ston par byed pa de srid bzlas pas chos gang nyan par 'dod pa de mngon par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: and whatever one wishes to hear.

original: de'i steng du bsgrubs na 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i steng du bsgrubs na 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accomplishes it above, it will blaze.

original: 'bar bar gyur pas lag na rdo rje rdo rje'i rigs su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bar bar gyur pas lag na rdo rje rdo rje'i rigs su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through blazing, one will enter the vajra family of Vajrapāṇi.

original: rdo rje ji lta ba bzhin du ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang / lcags kyu dang / glegs bam lag par blangs te bsgrubs pas rdo rje'i rigs su 'jug par 'gyur zhing thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ji lta ba bzhin du ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang / lcags kyu dang / glegs bam lag par blangs te bsgrubs pas rdo rje'i rigs su 'jug par 'gyur zhing thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, one should practice with a sword, a wheel, a hook, or a book in one’s hand. One will enter the Vajra family and become a vidyādhara with unimpeded movement everywhere.

original: gzhon nu'am / gzhon nu ma legs par khrus byas te /
analyzed: gzhon nu'am / gzhon nu ma legs par khrus byas te /
translated: “One should bathe a young boy or girl🔽and adorn him or her with ornaments.

original: rgyan gyis brgyan pa la sngon du bsnyen pa byas la ci 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: rgyan gyis brgyan pa la sngon du bsnyen pa byas la ci 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas te /
translated: Having performed the preliminary practice, one should make offerings of whatever one can afford.

original: nyin mtshan smyung bar mchod rten nam /
analyzed: nyin mtshan smyung bar mchod rten nam /
translated: For one day and night, fasting, one should sit on a bundle of kuśa grass in front of a stūpa,

original: lugs sku'am / glegs bam mam; bris sku'am /🔽gzhan dag gi mdun du ku sha'i gcal bkram pa la 'dug nas /
analyzed: lugs sku'am / glegs bam mam; bris sku'am / gzhan dag gi mdun du ku sha'i gcal bkram pa la 'dug nas /
translated: an image, a book, or a painting.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thal mo sbyar ba byas nas gsol ba btab la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thal mo sbyar ba byas nas gsol ba btab la /
translated: With palms joined, one should supplicate the buddhas and bodhisattvas.🔽Then one should offer into a smokeless fire🔽sandalwood,

original: de nas tsandan nam /🔽ga bur ram /
analyzed: de nas tsandan nam / ga bur ram /
translated: camphor,

original: gu gul lam /🔽du ru skas du ba med pa'i me mdag la sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: gu gul lam /🔽du ru skas du ba med pa'i me mdag la sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: agalloch,🔽or durvā grass.

original: de dag med na skyil mo krung gis 'dug ste /
analyzed: de dag med na skyil mo krung gis 'dug ste /
translated: If they are not present, one should sit cross-legged.

original: lag pas de dag bzung la ji srid gzhon nu dang / gzhon nu ma 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas pas rab tu 'bar zhing 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag pas de dag bzung la ji srid gzhon nu dang / gzhon nu ma 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas pas rab tu 'bar zhing 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should take them with one’s hand and recite the mantra until they become blazing young men and women.

original: lag pas blangs pa de @282b dag dang bcas par rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag pas blangs pa de @282b dag dang bcas par rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will fly up in flames, and by taking them with one’s hand, one will become a vidyādhara.

original: bud med legs par khrus byas shing rgyan gyis brgyan pa la ji srid skyes par gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bud med legs par khrus byas shing rgyan gyis brgyan pa la ji srid skyes par gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra until a well-bathed and adorned woman becomes a man.

original: dur khrod du bris pa'am /
analyzed: dur khrod du bris pa'am /
translated: One should draw a lion on a piece of cloth from a charnel ground,🔽or make it out of wood or clay. One should recite the mantra until it moves.

original: shing ngam / sa las byas pa'i seng+ge la ji srid 'gro bar gyur pa de srid bzlas pas de la zhon zhing gang du 'dod pa der 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing ngam / sa las byas pa'i seng+ge la ji srid 'gro bar gyur pa de srid bzlas pas de la zhon zhing gang du 'dod pa der 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should mount it and go wherever one wishes.

original: gal te nyin re rtag tu bzlas na gang du 'gro ba'i sa phyogs de bsrung ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nyin re rtag tu bzlas na gang du 'gro ba'i sa phyogs de bsrung ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra every day, the place where one goes will be protected.

original: gal te nyin mtshan du bsgrub pa byed na ni ji srid zhag lnga'am /
analyzed: gal te nyin mtshan du bsgrub pa byed na ni ji srid zhag lnga'am /
translated: If one performs the ritual service day and night, one will become a king of vidyādharas.

original: drug gam / brgyad dam /
analyzed: drug gam / brgyad dam /
translated: eight,

original: lhag ma'i zla ba phyed kyi nang du yar 'phags par 'gyur zhing lha rnams las kyang rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma'i zla ba phyed kyi nang du yar 'phags par 'gyur zhing lha rnams las kyang rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or in the remaining half-month, he will ascend and be victorious over the gods.

original: de la zhon na gang du 'dod pa der 'gro ba dang / 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la zhon na gang du 'dod pa der 'gro ba dang / 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Riding on him, he will go and come wherever he wishes.

original: de bzhin du rta'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rta'am /
translated: In the same way, if one repeats the mantra over a horse,

original: glang po che'am /🔽khyu mchog gam /
analyzed: glang po che'am / khyu mchog gam /
translated: an elephant,🔽a bull,

original: ma he'am / ra skyes sam /
analyzed: ma he'am / ra skyes sam /
translated: a buffalo, a goat,

original: lug gam / ri dags la bzlas na de dag thams cad nyid gang du ji srid 'dod pa de srid tu 'gro ba dang / 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lug gam / ri dags la bzlas na de dag thams cad nyid gang du ji srid 'dod pa de srid tu 'gro ba dang / 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or a sheep, all of them will go and come wherever and for as long as one wishes.

original: me tog gis rab tu gtor ba'i dkyil 'khor la dur khrod kyi shing la me sbar la mar dang / yungs kar gyis sbyin sreg byas na zla ba phyed kyi nang du nges par mkha' la 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog gis rab tu gtor ba'i dkyil 'khor la dur khrod kyi shing la me sbar la mar dang / yungs kar gyis sbyin sreg byas na zla ba phyed kyi nang du nges par mkha' la 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers a homa of ghee and mustard seeds in a maṇḍala strewn with flowers and a funeral pyre fire, he will certainly fly up into the sky within a fortnight.

original: dur khrod du ji lta ba bzhin du ri la sogs pa la yang gcig tu dben par 'dug ste bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: dur khrod du ji lta ba bzhin du ri la sogs pa la yang gcig tu dben par 'dug ste bsgrub pa'am /
translated: Just as in a charnel ground, one should practice in a solitary place such as a mountain, and so forth.

original: ngang pa la sogs pa bya la bsgrub pa'am /🔽cho ga @283a *//
analyzed: ngang pa la sogs pa bya la bsgrub pa'am / cho ga @283a *//
translated: implement such as a wooden sword,

original: 'di nyid kyis shing khri'am /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis shing khri'am /
translated: or on a wooden shoe, and so forth.

original: mchil lham la sogs pa la yang yid la 'dod pas cho ga bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: mchil lham la sogs pa la yang yid la 'dod pas cho ga bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish it according to the rite, as one wishes.

original: shing mya ngan med kyi yang ka la 'jus nas ji srid nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / mi snang bar 'gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: shing mya ngan med kyi yang ka la 'jus nas ji srid nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / mi snang bar 'gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra until one flies up into the sky and becomes invisible, holding on to a branch of an aśoka tree.

original: de bzhin du shing aa shvadtha dang / n+ya gro dha dang / n'a ga pushpa'i shing dang / shing til dkar dang / aa mra dang / dur khrod kyi shing la 'dzegs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shing aa shvadtha dang / n+ya gro dha dang / n'a ga pushpa'i shing dang / shing til dkar dang / aa mra dang / dur khrod kyi shing la 'dzegs te /
translated: In the same way, one should climb a tree of aśoka, banyan, nāgapuṣpa, white sesame, mango, or a tree in a charnel ground,

original: ji srid mi snang bar 'gro ba de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid mi snang bar 'gro ba de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
translated: and recite the mantra until one flies up into the sky and becomes invisible.

original: de ltar mi snang bar gyur bas lo stong 'tsho bar yang 'gyur zhing khru gang tsam gyis sa la ma reg par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi snang bar gyur bas lo stong 'tsho bar yang 'gyur zhing khru gang tsam gyis sa la ma reg par 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By becoming invisible in this way, one will live for one thousand years and walk without touching the ground with one’s feet.

original: bsod snyoms kyi 'tsho bas dur khrod du ji srid du mi snang bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi 'tsho bas dur khrod du ji srid du mi snang bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra until one disappears in the charnel ground, living on alms.

original: dur khrod du zhag lnga 'dug ste bzlas pa byas nas phyis de nyid du sa'i rang bzhin gyi mchod rten byas nas der me tog gi dkyil 'khor byas te thal ba lag pa'i kha sbyar du bcug ste ji srid du ba 'thul ba de srid du bzlas pa
analyzed: dur khrod du zhag lnga 'dug ste bzlas pa byas nas phyis de nyid du sa'i rang bzhin gyi mchod rten byas nas der me tog gi dkyil 'khor byas te thal ba lag pa'i kha sbyar du bcug ste ji srid du ba 'thul ba de srid du bzlas pa
translated: Having recited the mantra for five days in the charnel ground, one should make a stūpa of clay there, and having made a maṇḍala of flowers there, one should place the ashes in one’s cupped hands and recite the mantra until it smokes.

original: byas nas des mdzub ris gsum byas pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas nas des mdzub ris gsum byas pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having made three finger-widths of it, one will become invisible.

original: sha ma ta la'i rtsa bskam po phye mar byas te dur khrod du me tog gis mngon par gtor ba'i dkyil 'khor byas la lag pa kha sbyor ram /
analyzed: sha ma ta la'i rtsa bskam po phye mar byas te dur khrod du me tog gis mngon par gtor ba'i dkyil 'khor byas la lag pa kha sbyor ram /
translated: Having made a powder of the dried root of śamatala, one should make a maṇḍala with flowers in the charnel ground, and place it in one’s cupped hands or in a joined pair of bowls.

original: kham phor kha sbyar du bcug ste ji srid du ba @283b 'thul ba de srid du bzlas la des mig la bskus na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kham phor kha sbyar du bcug ste ji srid du ba @283b 'thul ba de srid du bzlas la des mig la bskus na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should recite the mantra until it smokes. Having anointed one’s eyes with it, one will become invisible.

original: de bzhin du 'gro na pushpa dang / aa ti pa l'a dang / aindra ba ru ni rnams kyi rtsa ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro na pushpa dang / aa ti pa l'a dang / aindra ba ru ni rnams kyi rtsa ba'am /
translated: Likewise, if one wishes to go, one should take the root of puṣpa, atipāla, or indravāruṇī,

original: shu dag gam /🔽aa pa r'a tsi ta'am /
analyzed: shu dag gam / aa pa r'a tsi ta'am /
translated: or take śigru,🔽or take apārācitā,

original: aa pa ra ti ni'am /🔽padma ku shu ka'am /
analyzed: aa pa ra ti ni'am / padma ku shu ka'am /
translated: or take aparājitā,🔽or take padmakaṣāya,

original: padma'i sdong bu'i rtsa ba'am /
analyzed: padma'i sdong bu'i rtsa ba'am /
translated: or take the root of a lotus stalk,

original: dando pa la'am /
analyzed: dando pa la'am /
translated: or take dāḍima,

original: autpa la'i me tog gam /
analyzed: autpa la'i me tog gam /
translated: or take utpala flowers,

original: mi'i sha'am / rma bya'i sha'am /
analyzed: mi'i sha'am / rma bya'i sha'am /
translated: or take human flesh, or take peacock flesh,

original: tsha ba gsum mam /
analyzed: tsha ba gsum mam /
translated: or take the three pungent substances,

original: ra dza pa ta'am /
analyzed: ra dza pa ta'am /
translated: or take rājapūtrī,

original: spos dkar ba'am /🔽gzhan dag phye mar byas te /
analyzed: spos dkar ba'am / gzhan dag phye mar byas te /
translated: or take white sandalwood,🔽or take any other [substance] as a powder,

original: kham phor kha sbyar ram /
analyzed: kham phor kha sbyar ram /
translated: and place it between two joined bowls

original: lag pa kha sbyar du bcug ste ji srid du ba 'thul ba de srid du bzlas pa des mig la bskus na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag pa kha sbyar du bcug ste ji srid du ba 'thul ba de srid du bzlas pa des mig la bskus na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or between the palms of one's hands. As long as it smokes, one should recite. By anointing one's eyes with it, one will become invisible.

original: dur khrod du sbrang rtsi la lan stong mngon par sngags te /
analyzed: dur khrod du sbrang rtsi la lan stong mngon par sngags te /
translated: In a charnel ground, one should enchant honey one thousand times

original: mig la bskus na ma mthong ba thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la bskus na ma mthong ba thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and anoint one's eyes with it. One will see all that is unseen.

original: dgon par mchod rten gyi logs la shing rta bris la ji srid zla ba phyed kyi nang du 'gul bar gyur pa de srid nyin mtshan bzlas la de la zhon na kun tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgon par mchod rten gyi logs la shing rta bris la ji srid zla ba phyed kyi nang du 'gul bar gyur pa de srid nyin mtshan bzlas la de la zhon na kun tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In a temple, one should draw a chariot on the wall of a stūpa, and recite [the mantra] day and night for as long as it moves. If one mounts it, one will be able to go everywhere.

original: ba bla blangs te dben ba'i mchod rten nam /
analyzed: ba bla blangs te dben ba'i mchod rten nam /
translated: Taking bovine bezoar, in a secluded stūpa,

original: dgon pa'am / ri la sogs pa la ji srid dngos grub gsum grub par 'gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: dgon pa'am / ri la sogs pa la ji srid dngos grub gsum grub par 'gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: in a temple, or on a mountain, and so on, one should recite [the mantra] for as long as one wishes to accomplish the three accomplishments.

original: de bzhin du gi wang dang / lig bu mig la sogs pa la bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gi wang dang / lig bu mig la sogs pa la bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should practice with realgar, orpiment, and so on.

original: dge slong gis rtag tu chos gos dang / lhung bzed dang / 'khar gsil la sogs pa blangs la bzlas pa bya zhing 'jog pa na bsrung ba byas te gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis rtag tu chos gos dang / lhung bzed dang / 'khar gsil la sogs pa blangs la bzlas pa bya zhing 'jog pa na bsrung ba byas te gzhag par bya'o //
translated: A monk should always take the Dharma robes, alms bowl, staff, and so on, recite [the mantra], and when putting them away, he should do so with protection.

original: de @284a *// lta bu la sogs pa'i las su bya ba byed pa na yid la 'dod pa'i cho gas bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: de @284a *// lta bu la sogs pa'i las su bya ba byed pa na yid la 'dod pa'i cho gas bsgrub pa'am /
translated: When performing such and other activities, one should practice according to the desired ritual.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rtog pa'i cho gas bsgrubs na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po 'di 'dod pa phun sum tshogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rtog pa'i cho gas bsgrubs na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po 'di 'dod pa phun sum tshogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accomplishes this essence of the Blessed Buddhas by means of the ritual of the imagination of all the Tathāgatas, it will bring about the fulfillment of all wishes.

original: thogs pa med par don yod pa'i yid la 'dod pa'i cho ga ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med par don yod pa'i yid la 'dod pa'i cho ga ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish it by means of the ritual of the mind that is unimpeded and unfailing, just as one wishes.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'di ltar bdag por khas blangs nas phyag 'tshal ba dang / dmigs pa dang / bzlas pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpar bcas pa rjes su dran zhing bzlas pa goms par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'di ltar bdag por khas blangs nas phyag 'tshal ba dang / dmigs pa dang / bzlas pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpar bcas pa rjes su dran zhing bzlas pa goms par bya'o //
translated: Having thus accepted the lordship of all the Tathāgatas together with the Bodhisattvas, one should pay homage to them, and by means of visualization and recitation, one should practice the familiarization with the recitation while recollecting the Buddhas together with the Bodhisattvas.

original: gal te skyil krung ma bshig par mtshan mo gcig pur ri la sogs pa dri zhim pa dben ba na dben bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: gal te skyil krung ma bshig par mtshan mo gcig pur ri la sogs pa dri zhim pa dben ba na dben bar 'dug ste /
translated: If one sits alone at night on a mountain or in a fragrant secluded place without breaking the cross-legged posture,

original: bzlas pa byed na nyi ma shar ba'i dus kyi tshe bsnyen pa ma byas par yang rig pa 'dzin par nges par mtshan gcig gis 'grub bo //
analyzed: bzlas pa byed na nyi ma shar ba'i dus kyi tshe bsnyen pa ma byas par yang rig pa 'dzin par nges par mtshan gcig gis 'grub bo //
translated: If one recites [the mantra], then even without having done repetition, one will certainly become a knowledge-holder in one night.

original: tsog pur 'dug nas byas na gdon mi za bar zla ba phyed kyi nang du lus yongs su 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: tsog pur 'dug nas byas na gdon mi za bar zla ba phyed kyi nang du lus yongs su 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: If one does [the repetition] while sitting cross-legged, one will certainly transform one’s body within half a month.

original: dkyil 'khor me tog la sogs pas mngon par gtor bar byas la mchod rten la mngon du phyogs pa'am /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor me tog la sogs pas mngon par gtor bar byas la mchod rten la mngon du phyogs pa'am /
translated: Having scattered flowers, etc. on the maṇḍala, facing a stūpa,

original: lugs sku la mngon par phyogs pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems @284b dpa' thams cad la bdag dbul zhing stong phrag brgyad bzlas na dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i las kyi sgrib pa rnams spong bar byed do //

original: 'dod pa skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i @287b rig pas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu 'dod pas rgyal bar byed cing /
analyzed: 'dod pa skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i @287b rig pas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu 'dod pas rgyal bar byed cing /
translated: who, through the knowledge called “arouser of desire,” causes the gods in the desire realm to be overcome by desire.
