analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod yongs su longs spyod pa yang yang dag par ston par byed do //
translated: He also manifests the enjoyment of desired objects.

original: me tog rnam pa sna tshogs pa mang po dang / rin po che dang / nor bu yod pa'i sa phyogs dang / yo byad dang / longs spyod nye bar stobs par byed do //🔽'di lta ste /🔽yang lha'i bu dbang phyug ces bya ba yod de des yid ltar mgyogs pa zhes bya ba'i rig pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi las su bya ba byed cing yo byad dang / longs spyod mngon par sprul nas gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams la yang nye bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: me tog rnam pa sna tshogs pa mang po dang / rin po che dang / nor bu yod pa'i sa phyogs dang / yo byad dang / longs spyod nye bar stobs par byed do // 'di lta ste / yang lha'i bu dbang phyug ces bya ba yod de des yid ltar mgyogs pa zhes bya ba'i rig pas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi las su bya ba byed cing yo byad dang / longs spyod mngon par sprul nas gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams la yang nye bar ston par byed do //
translated: He provides the ground that has many kinds of flowers, jewels, and gems, as well as the requisites and enjoyments.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There is also a god called Īśvara. By means of the knowledge called “swift as thought,” he performs activities in the trichiliocosm, emanates requisites and enjoyments, and also manifests them to the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa class.

original: yang rig pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis gos dang / bza' ba dang; btung ba dang / gzhal yas khang dang / skyed mos tshal dang / dri dang / me tog dang / phye ma dang / phreng ba la sogs pa mngon par sprul nas yongs su longs spyod par byed cing gzhan dag la ster bar byed do //
analyzed: yang rig pa 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis gos dang / bza' ba dang; btung ba dang / gzhal yas khang dang / skyed mos tshal dang / dri dang / me tog dang / phye ma dang / phreng ba la sogs pa mngon par sprul nas yongs su longs spyod par byed cing gzhan dag la ster bar byed do //
translated: “They will also manifest through the mantra called ‘Vidyādhara’ the enjoyment of clothes, food, drink, palaces, gardens, scents, flowers, powders, garlands, and so forth, and they will give them to others.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is like this:

original: yang mig 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mig 'phrul mkhan zhes bya bas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mig 'phrul ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang mig 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mig 'phrul mkhan zhes bya bas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mig 'phrul ston par byed do //
translated: A magician called ‘various illusions’ will display various illusions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is like this:

original: yang lha ma yin rnams sngags kyi sgyu ma byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang lha ma yin rnams sngags kyi sgyu ma byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The asuras will perform magical feats through mantras.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is like this:

original: yang sman bas sngags kyis sems can mang po rnams kyi @288a *//
analyzed: yang sman bas sngags kyis sems can mang po rnams kyi @288a *//
translated: A doctor will cure many beings

original: rims sel bar byed cing /
analyzed: rims sel bar byed cing /
translated: of fevers,

original: yi dvags dang / dug dang / nad rnams sel bar byed do //
analyzed: yi dvags dang / dug dang / nad rnams sel bar byed do //
translated: ghosts, poisons, and diseases through mantras.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is like this:

original: yang sngags kyis me'i dro ba med par byed cing grang ba yang dro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang sngags kyis me'i dro ba med par byed cing grang ba yang dro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, by means of a mantra, one can remove the heat of fire and make the cold warm.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: yang mngon par gnod par byed pas rims kyis 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: yang mngon par gnod par byed pas rims kyis 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Again, by means of a mantra, one can cause a person to be seized by a fever due to the influence of a spirit.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: yang ma mo'i rtog pas sems can mang po rnams la gsod pa dang / rnam par 'tshe bar byed do //
analyzed: yang ma mo'i rtog pas sems can mang po rnams la gsod pa dang / rnam par 'tshe bar byed do //
translated: Again, by means of a mantra, one can cause many beings to be killed and injured due to the influence of a demoness.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / sdig pa rnams la sdig pa'i sngags kyis sdig pa la sbyor bar yang byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sdig pa rnams la sdig pa'i sngags kyis sdig pa la sbyor bar yang byed do //
translated: one can cause evil people to engage in evil deeds by means of an evil mantra.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: yang gnod sbyin gyi sems rnam par g-yo bar byed pa'i sngags kyis sems dga' ba dang / yid bde ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan dag kyang byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gnod sbyin gyi sems rnam par g-yo bar byed pa'i sngags kyis sems dga' ba dang / yid bde ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan dag kyang byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, by means of a mantra that agitates the minds of yakshas, one can cause the mind to be joyful, happy, and so on, and also cause others to do so.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i nges pa ston pa ni sngags kyi stobs yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i nges pa ston pa ni sngags kyi stobs yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Such certainty should be seen as the power of mantras.

original: gsang sngags de'i stobs ni gsang sngags nyid las 'byung ba yang ma yin //
analyzed: gsang sngags de'i stobs ni gsang sngags nyid las 'byung ba yang ma yin //
translated: The power of that mantra does not arise from the mantra itself,

original: sems can las 'jug pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: sems can las 'jug pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not the case that the activity of sentient beings is not engaged in.

original: sbyor ba byas pa yang mi dmigs mod kyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba byas pa yang mi dmigs mod kyi /
translated: It is not the case that the performance of the rite is not observed.

original: sngon gyi bsnyen pa'i cho ga las gsang sngags kyi stobs rab tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi bsnyen pa'i cho ga las gsang sngags kyi stobs rab tu shes par bya'o //
translated: However, the power of the mantra should be fully understood from the rite of prior service.

original: byin gyis brlabs kyi chos nyid las byung ba las 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs kyi chos nyid las byung ba las 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not the case that it transcends the nature of reality, which is the blessing.

original: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid 'di yang 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi chos nyid 'di yang 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba yang ma yin /
translated: This nature of all phenomena is neither coming nor going.

original: dmigs pa @288b yang ma yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa @288b yang ma yin /
translated: It is not an object of apprehension.

original: 'gro bar byed pa yang ma yin //🔽byed pa po yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pa yang ma yin // byed pa po yang ma yin /
translated: It is not that which causes going.🔽It is not an agent.

original: byed pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: byed pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not an action.

original: bden par gyur pa mi slu ba yin te /
analyzed: bden par gyur pa mi slu ba yin te /
translated: It is a true, nondeceptive reality.

original: de bas na dad pas sngags 'dis sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dad pas sngags 'dis sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o //
translated: Therefore, with faith in this mantra, one should work for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: tshe 'di nyid la mthong ba'i chos kyi yon tan 'dod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug par 'dod pa dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed 'dod pa dang / yon tan rin po che so sor thob par 'dod pas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la mthong ba'i chos kyi yon tan 'dod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug par 'dod pa dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed 'dod pa dang / yon tan rin po che so sor thob par 'dod pas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish this with the desire for the good qualities of the Dharma to be seen in this very life, with the desire to enter into the conduct of the bodhisattvas, with the desire to complete the accumulations of merit and wisdom, and with the desire to attain individually the precious qualities.

original: sems can gyi don gyi phyir mngon par brjod pa'i sbyor ba 'dis bsgrubs na myur ba kho nar ji ltar 'dod pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi phyir mngon par brjod pa'i sbyor ba 'dis bsgrubs na myur ba kho nar ji ltar 'dod pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accomplishes this by means of this application of mantra for the sake of sentient beings, one will quickly attain the state of a knowledge-holder and so forth, just as one desires.

original: gzhan yang / sems can rnams la phan pa'i rgyur gyur ba ji skad du bshad pa'i dngos grub kyi go 'phang gang yin pa rnam par bsams la bzlas pa 'bum byas na nges par de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal mthong zhing mgo la byugs te ji ltar 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyang
analyzed: gzhan yang / sems can rnams la phan pa'i rgyur gyur ba ji skad du bshad pa'i dngos grub kyi go 'phang gang yin pa rnam par bsams la bzlas pa 'bum byas na nges par de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal mthong zhing mgo la byugs te ji ltar 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyang
translated: Moreover, one should contemplate the state of attainment, which is the cause of benefit for sentient beings, as explained above. If one recites one hundred thousand times, one will certainly see the face of the Tathāgata, be anointed on the head, and attain whatever siddhi one desires.

original: myur du stsol bar mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du stsol bar mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: will quickly be granted.

original: yid kyis las su bya ba ci 'dod pa la sbyor ba'ang rung /
analyzed: yid kyis las su bya ba ci 'dod pa la sbyor ba'ang rung /
translated: Whatever mental activity one wishes to engage in,

original: rtog pa'i cho ga gzhan nam /
analyzed: rtog pa'i cho ga gzhan nam /
translated: or another imagined ritual,

original: sngags 'di la rtogs pa thams cad kyi cho gas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di la rtogs pa thams cad kyi cho gas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: one should apply this mantra according to the ritual of all realizations.

original: dam tshig gsum gyi rgyal po las gsungs pa'i cho ga las /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i @289a *//
analyzed: dam tshig gsum gyi rgyal po las gsungs pa'i cho ga las / de bzhin gshegs pa'i @289a *//
translated: From the ritual taught in the King of the Three Pledges,

original: snying po'i le'u rdzogs so ////
analyzed: snying po'i le'u rdzogs so ////
translated: the chapter on the essence of the Tathāgata is complete.

original: yang de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi mchog ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: yang de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi mchog ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: At that time, the Blessed One entered the meditative absorption called the king of meditative absorptions, supreme among all.

original: snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu sku'i yan lag thams cad las de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba'i rig pa'i rgyal po byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu sku'i yan lag thams cad las de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba'i rig pa'i rgyal po byung bar gyur to //
translated: As soon as he entered it, from all the limbs of his body emerged the king of awareness mantras called supreme domain of all the Tathāgatas.

original: na ma:sarba buddha bo dhi satva n'am/
analyzed: na ma:sarba buddha bo dhi satva n'am/
translated: Namo to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas!

original: aom aa ma la bi kr'anta te dz'i ni aa ra dze sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom aa ma la bi kr'anta te dz'i ni aa ra dze sv'ah'a /
translated: Om amalavikṛntatejinī araje svaha.

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: 'di ni chos kyi spyod yul mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rig pa mchog /
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi spyod yul mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rig pa mchog /
translated: This is the supreme knowledge of the thus-gone ones, whose domain is the Dharma without end or middle.

original: thogs pa med pa don yod par grub pa'i rig sngags chen po rtog pa'i sbyor ba rab 'byams yangs pa mtha' med pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa don yod par grub pa'i rig sngags chen po rtog pa'i sbyor ba rab 'byams yangs pa mtha' med pa /
translated: It is the great mantra that accomplishes the unfailing, the unobstructed, the vast, infinite, and supreme knowledge.

original: sngags kyi sgor zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'dis las rnams gang bag med pa'i sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs ma gtogs par smyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags kyi sgor zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'dis las rnams gang bag med pa'i sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs ma gtogs par smyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This mantra is the activity of the bodhisattvas who have entered the gateway of the mantra vehicle and are practicing the bodhisattva conduct. If a bodhisattva who has generated the first level of bodhicitta were to carelessly recite this mantra, they would go insane unless they were blessed by the thus-gone ones.

original: mdor bstan na bzlas pa tsam gyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor bstan na bzlas pa tsam gyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In short, simply by reciting it, one will perform the deeds of the buddhas.”

original: gsang sngags kyi spyod pa rjes su thob nas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sku sems can gyi khams thams cad la yang @289b dag par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi spyod pa rjes su thob nas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sku sems can gyi khams thams cad la yang @289b dag par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having attained the practice of secret mantra, they will perfectly reveal the bodies of the various tathāgatas and the bodies of bodhisattvas to all realms of sentient beings.

original: mos pa sna tshogs pa rnams la 'tsham par 'khor ba las zlog pa'i phyir sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du thams cad du song ba thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i gsang sngags chen po 'dis sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bsod nams dang /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs pa rnams la 'tsham par 'khor ba las zlog pa'i phyir sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du thams cad du song ba thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i gsang sngags chen po 'dis sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bsod nams dang /
translated: In order to turn away from saṃsāra those with various aspirations, they will, like magicians, go everywhere, unimpeded, with this great secret mantra.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs las byung ba mtha' dang / dpus med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i stobs dang / dge bas rgyas par byas pa'i sems kyi 'jug pas byin gyis brlabs pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung gi 'khor lo dang /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs las byung ba mtha' dang / dpus med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i stobs dang / dge bas rgyas par byas pa'i sems kyi 'jug pas byin gyis brlabs pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung gi 'khor lo dang /
translated: With the power of the blessings of the tathāgatas, who are without end or middle, and who arise from the accumulation of merit and wisdom of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and with the power of the blessings of the mind that is expanded by virtue, they will turn the wheel of speech of the tathāgatas.

original: gzhan dag kyang sems can gyi khams rnams las 'byung zhing thos par 'gyur cig ces sems can thams cad bskyab par dmigs nas sngags bzlas nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs kyi stobs kyi shugs la dad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang sems can gyi khams rnams las 'byung zhing thos par 'gyur cig ces sems can thams cad bskyab par dmigs nas sngags bzlas nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs kyi stobs kyi shugs la dad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should recite the mantra with the aim of protecting all sentient beings, and one should have faith in the power of the blessings of the Tathagatas.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa bas tha na gzung ba tsam la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa bas tha na gzung ba tsam la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who is in the Bodhisattva Vehicle should apply himself to this mantra, even if only to memorize it.

original: rtog pa 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis don yod pa thogs pa med pa smon lam gyi stobs dang / byin gyis brlabs kyi stobs kyis dngos grub byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis don yod pa thogs pa med pa smon lam gyi stobs dang / byin gyis brlabs kyi stobs kyis dngos grub byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
translated: In this tantra, the Blessed Buddha has blessed the attainment of the power of unobstructed, unfailing prayer and the power of blessing.

original: de las 'dir rig pa 'dzin pa thob pa'i thabs phyogs tsam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de las 'dir rig pa 'dzin pa thob pa'i thabs phyogs tsam brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, I will speak a little about the means of attaining the state of a knowledge-holder.

original: 'dir dad pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pas @290a *//
analyzed: 'dir dad pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pas @290a *//
translated: Here, a faithful follower of the Bodhisattva Vehicle

original: re zhig sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la snga ma bzhin du bdag gi lus dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la snga ma bzhin du bdag gi lus dbul bar bya'o //
translated: First, as before, I offer my body to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de nas dus thams cad pa'i sdig pa bshags te /
analyzed: de nas dus thams cad pa'i sdig pa bshags te /
translated: Then I confess all my sins of every time,

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las byung ba rnams nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du bshags par bya'o; ;de nas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las byung ba rnams nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du bshags par bya'o; ;de nas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas dang /
translated: whatever I have done, caused to be done, or consented to be done by body, speech, or mind, by the force of the afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
translated: Then I rejoice in all the merit and wisdom of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the past, present, and future.

original: sems can thams cad skyob cing phan par mdzad pa la rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad skyob cing phan par mdzad pa la rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: I rejoice in the protection and benefit of all sentient beings.

original: dpag tu med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa sems can gyi don mdzad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa nyid la yang rjes su yi rang ngo //🔽de nas 'di ltar yang bsam par bya'o; ;de bzhin gshegs pa gcig cig gi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyang tshad med do zhes rjes su yi rang nas sems can thams cad kyi phyir yongs su bsngo na mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa rgya chen po 'byung bar 'gyur na gang yang sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa sems can gyi don mdzad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa nyid la yang rjes su yi rang ngo // de nas 'di ltar yang bsam par bya'o; ;de bzhin gshegs pa gcig cig gi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyang tshad med do zhes rjes su yi rang nas sems can thams cad kyi phyir yongs su bsngo na mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa rgya chen po 'byung bar 'gyur na gang yang sangs rgyas dang /
translated: I rejoice in the benefit that is brought to beings by the infinite Tathāgatas and by the Bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mtha' yas pa /🔽@290b mtha' mi mthong ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mtha' yas pa / @290b mtha' mi mthong ba /
translated: Then one should think as follows: “Even the accumulation of merit and wisdom of a single Tathāgata is immeasurable. Having rejoiced in this way, if I dedicate it to all sentient beings, an immeasurable and infinite result will ripen. What need is there to speak of the infinite Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,🔽who are beyond measure,🔽beyond limit,

original: tshad med pa khong du chud par byas nas rjes su yi rang ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: tshad med pa khong du chud par byas nas rjes su yi rang ba lta ci smos /
translated: and beyond comprehension?

original: yang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa gang yin pa des rjes su yi rang ngo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa gang yin pa des rjes su yi rang ngo zhes brjod do //
translated: Or else, one should say, “I rejoice in whatever the Blessed Buddhas know.”

original: de nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang dag par byung ba /
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yang dag par byung ba /
translated: Then, having arisen in all world-realms,

original: bdag gi med pa rjes su ma bzung ba /
analyzed: bdag gi med pa rjes su ma bzung ba /
translated: without a self, not grasped,

original: thang las skyes pa rin po che'i ri la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mchod pa'i don du bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: thang las skyes pa rin po che'i ri la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la mchod pa'i don du bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: one should dedicate the earth-born jewels, such as mountains of jewels, for the sake of making offerings to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de nas bdag gi bsod nams kyi stobs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du chos kyi dbyings las spros pa'i dam pa rgya chen po'i mchod pa'i sprin sna tshogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs dang /
analyzed: de nas bdag gi bsod nams kyi stobs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du chos kyi dbyings las spros pa'i dam pa rgya chen po'i mchod pa'i sprin sna tshogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs dang /
translated: Then, by the power of one’s merit, one should resolve, “May the various clouds of sublime, vast offerings, which are emanated from the realm of phenomena in the maṇḍalas of all the Tathāgatas, arise through the blessings of the Tathāgatas

original: bdag gi smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'byung bar gyur cig ces nges par bsams la /
analyzed: bdag gi smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'byung bar gyur cig ces nges par bsams la /
translated: and the power of my aspirations.”

original: 'di skad lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this eight times.

original: na ma:sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma:sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
translated: namas sarva buddhānāṃ bodhisatvā nāṃ ca

original: sarba th'a aut ga te spha ra na h'i m'am ga ga na kham sa manta ta sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sarba th'a aut ga te spha ra na h'i m'am ga ga na kham sa manta ta sv'ah'a /
translated: sarva thā utgate spharaṇa hīmaṃ gagana khaṃ samaṃta tā svāhā

original: de'i rjes la gzhan ma yin par de bzhin du mchod pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar mkhyen pa bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yon tan bsngags pa mtha' yas pa rab 'byams @291a *//
analyzed: de'i rjes la gzhan ma yin par de bzhin du mchod pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar mkhyen pa bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yon tan bsngags pa mtha' yas pa rab 'byams @291a *//
translated: After that, just as the Tathāgatas know, the offerings will arise in the same way, without being otherwise.🔽Then, one should think, “By the power of my aspiration and the power of my merit, may the oceans of infinite, extensive praises of the qualities of all the Tathāgatas and all the Bodhisattvas arise by the blessings of the Tathāgatas.”

original: rgya mtsho rnams bdag gi smon lam gyi stobs dang / bsod nams kyi stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis 'byung bar gyur cig ces bsams la sngags 'di lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rnams bdag gi smon lam gyi stobs dang / bsod nams kyi stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis 'byung bar gyur cig ces bsams la sngags 'di lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this mantra eight times.

original: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
translated: namas sarva buddhānāṃ bodhisatvā nāṃ ca

original: sarba tr'am sam ku su mi t'a aa bhi dzny'a na r'a shi ni na mo stu te sv'ah'a; de nas bstod pa yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya mtsho rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sarba tr'am sam ku su mi t'a aa bhi dzny'a na r'a shi ni na mo stu te sv'ah'a; de nas bstod pa yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya mtsho rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the ocean of praises should be uttered just as the Tathāgatas know them.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis thams cad du sdug bsngal bar gyur pa bdag la byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis thams cad du sdug bsngal bar gyur pa bdag la byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
translated: Then one should say, “May all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas bless me everywhere,

original: bdag la dngos grub dang / mchog stsal du gsol zhes tshig tu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la dngos grub dang / mchog stsal du gsol zhes tshig tu brjod par bya'o //
translated: and grant me the accomplishments and the supreme.”

original: de nas sems can thams cad kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs zag pa med pa rnal 'byor las yang dag par byung ba rab tu thob par gyur cig ces kyang brjod do //
analyzed: de nas sems can thams cad kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs zag pa med pa rnal 'byor las yang dag par byung ba rab tu thob par gyur cig ces kyang brjod do //
translated: Then one should say, “May all sentient beings obtain the accumulation of roots of virtue, which is undefiled, arises from yoga, and is supreme.”

original: de bzhin du mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba sbyin par yid la byas nas de lta bu'i sprul pa'i sprin mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor bas bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i sngags lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba sbyin par yid la byas nas de lta bu'i sprul pa'i sprin mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i sbyor bas bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i sngags lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, having brought to mind the bestowal of benefit and happiness upon all sentient beings, who are without end and without middle, one should recite the mantra of the essence of the Tathāgata’s heart, which is the means of accomplishing such a cloud of emanations, up to eight times.

original: de nas sangs @291b rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal zhing dmigs la bzlas pa goms par byas nas /
analyzed: de nas sangs @291b rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal zhing dmigs la bzlas pa goms par byas nas /
translated: Then, having paid homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and having become familiar with the recitation while visualizing them,

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub grub par gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad grub par gyur pa de dag la rjes su yi rang ba la dmigs pa'i sems kyis goms par byas shing bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub grub par gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad grub par gyur pa de dag la rjes su yi rang ba la dmigs pa'i sems kyis goms par byas shing bzlas par bya ste /
translated: one should recite the mantra with a mind that is familiar with and focused on rejoicing in the accomplishment of unsurpassed perfect awakening by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and in the accomplishment of all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: ji srid skyo bar ma gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid skyo bar ma gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: One should do this until one becomes weary.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas bla na med pa'i seng+ge'i sgra sgrogs pa dang; bla na med pa'i sems can gyi don mdzad cing //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas bla na med pa'i seng+ge'i sgra sgrogs pa dang; bla na med pa'i sems can gyi don mdzad cing //
translated: Then, by the turning of the wheel of the Dharma by the Tathāgatas, the lion’s roar of the unsurpassed is proclaimed, and the unsurpassed benefit of sentient beings is accomplished.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun tu bzang po ye shes kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa la mngon par mos pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal nas langs te 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa la sogs pa yangs shing rgya che ba'i mdo sde bklag pa 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun tu bzang po ye shes kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa la mngon par mos pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal nas langs te 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa la sogs pa yangs shing rgya che ba'i mdo sde bklag pa 'am /
translated: With devotion to the Tathāgata Samantabhadra, whose wisdom body is perfect, having paid homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, one should rise and read the noble Sūtras of extensive and vast meaning, such as the Gaṇḍavyūha,

original: gzhan yang rung ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du snga dro dus kyi bar du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ji ltar bsams pa bzhin du snga dro dus kyi bar du gnas par bya'o //
translated: or whatever else one has contemplated, until the end of the morning.

original: de nas glegs bam la sogs pa mchod pa 'am /
analyzed: de nas glegs bam la sogs pa mchod pa 'am /
translated: Then, having made offerings to the scriptures and so forth,

original: tha na mchod rten la phyag 'tshal byas nas zas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: tha na mchod rten la phyag 'tshal byas nas zas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: or even having paid homage to a stūpa, one should eat.

original: za ba'i tshe kha zas la sngags 'dis lan brgyad mngon par sngags la dang po'i chang bu lha bshos su phul la bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: za ba'i tshe kha zas la sngags 'dis lan brgyad mngon par sngags la dang po'i chang bu lha bshos su phul la bza' bar bya'o //
translated: When eating, one should incant the food eight times with this mantra, and first offer a mouthful as a bali.

original: de la sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra is as follows:

original: na @292a *// ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
analyzed: na @292a *// ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
translated: namaḥ sarvabuddhabodhisattvebhyaḥ.

original: aom ba lint'a te /
analyzed: aom ba lint'a te /
translated: oṃ baliṃ te

original: te dzo m'a li ni sv'ah'a /
analyzed: te dzo m'a li ni sv'ah'a /
translated: tejomaṇilini svāhā.

original: zas kyis dub pa cung zhing ngal bsos la phyi dro'i dus su yang cho ga 'di bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: zas kyis dub pa cung zhing ngal bsos la phyi dro'i dus su yang cho ga 'di bzhin du bya'o //
translated: When tired from eating, one should rest and do this rite again in the evening.

original: nyal ba'i tshe dang por sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yan lag thams cad kyis phyag 'tshal nas bdag nyid phul la phyi nas mal du ji ltar 'dod par gnyid log la nam gyi cha stod dang / cha smad la mi nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyal ba'i tshe dang por sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yan lag thams cad kyis phyag 'tshal nas bdag nyid phul la phyi nas mal du ji ltar 'dod par gnyid log la nam gyi cha stod dang / cha smad la mi nyal bar bya'o //
translated: When going to sleep, first one should pay homage with all limbs to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, offer oneself, and then go to sleep in bed as desired. One should not sleep during the first and last periods of the night.

original: de la cho ga ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de la cho ga ni 'di yin no //
translated: The rite is as follows:

original: tshes gcig nas brtsams nas nyin re zhing zla ba gcig rdzogs kyi bar du 'di bzhin du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshes gcig nas brtsams nas nyin re zhing zla ba gcig rdzogs kyi bar du 'di bzhin du bya ba yin no //
translated: Starting from the first day, one should do this every day for a month.

original: gal te cho ga 'ga' zhig ma byas sam /
analyzed: gal te cho ga 'ga' zhig ma byas sam /
translated: If one has not performed some rite,

original: bya ba gzhan gyis brel bas nyi ma gcig gam /🔽gnyis sam / gsum la sogs par las las nyams na yang des brtson 'grus dor bar mi bya ste zla ba de nyid kyi nya la nyin mtshan gcig tu bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'am /
analyzed: bya ba gzhan gyis brel bas nyi ma gcig gam / gnyis sam / gsum la sogs par las las nyams na yang des brtson 'grus dor bar mi bya ste zla ba de nyid kyi nya la nyin mtshan gcig tu bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'am /
translated: or is busy with other activities, and so one has neglected the practice for one day,🔽two days, three days, and so on, one should not give up one’s effort.

original: mchod rten dang / sku gzugs dang / dam pa'i chos glegs bam mam /
analyzed: mchod rten dang / sku gzugs dang / dam pa'i chos glegs bam mam /
translated: On the full moon day of that very month, one should make offerings to the Blessed One for a whole day and night, either in front of a stūpa, an image, or a book of the sublime Dharma,

original: gzhan gyi mdun du yang rung /
analyzed: gzhan gyi mdun du yang rung /
translated: or in front of another [image].

original: mchod pa ci 'byor pa byas nas ku sha bkram pa la 'dug ste bsrung ba'i cho ga byas nas 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang; rtse gsum dang / mdung dang / kha tv'am ga yang rung /🔽lcags las byas pa 'am /
analyzed: mchod pa ci 'byor pa byas nas ku sha bkram pa la 'dug ste bsrung ba'i cho ga byas nas 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang; rtse gsum dang / mdung dang / kha tv'am ga yang rung / lcags las byas pa 'am /
translated: Having made offerings to the best of one’s ability, one should lie down on a spread of kuśa grass, perform the protection rite, and hold in one’s hand a wheel, a vajra, a trident, a spear, or a khaṭvāṅga,🔽made of iron,

original: sa las byas pa yang rung /
analyzed: sa las byas pa yang rung /
translated: or made of earth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i le'u nas gsungs @292b pa'i mtshon cha rnams las gang 'dod pa zhig lag tu blangs nas bsgrub pa byas na des nam phyed dam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i le'u nas gsungs @292b pa'i mtshon cha rnams las gang 'dod pa zhig lag tu blangs nas bsgrub pa byas na des nam phyed dam /
translated: If you take up any of the weapons taught in the chapter on the essence of the tathagatas and perform the practice, you will achieve the feat of becoming a hero.🔽

original: nyi ma 'char kar nges par 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma 'char kar nges par 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs the ritual action while holding in one’s hand any of the weapons taught in the chapter on the essence of the tathāgatas, it will definitely blaze at midnight or at sunrise.

original: de nyid rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: One will become a knowledge-holder.

original: skad cig de la rig 'dzin gyi rigs kun nye bar 'dus nas de la dbang bskur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig de la rig 'dzin gyi rigs kun nye bar 'dus nas de la dbang bskur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that very instant, all the families of knowledge-holders will gather and confer empowerment on him.

original: de nas bzung nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du nam mkha' la rgyu zhing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du rjes su 'jug cing mchod pa byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la zhugs nas bde ba dang ldan bzhin du
analyzed: de nas bzung nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du nam mkha' la rgyu zhing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du rjes su 'jug cing mchod pa byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la zhugs nas bde ba dang ldan bzhin du
translated: From that point on, one will enter the bodhisattva way of life, moving through the sky in all the world systems, entering into the maṇḍalas of the retinue of all the tathāgatas, making offerings, and being endowed with happiness.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin thams cad kyis mchod cing rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad mngon par dga' bar byed pa'i rig sngags 'dzin pa'i rgyal po chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin thams cad kyis mchod cing rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad mngon par dga' bar byed pa'i rig sngags 'dzin pa'i rgyal po chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be worshipped by all gods, nāgas, and yakṣas, and will become a great king of vidyādharas, delighting all the vidyādharas.

original: mtha' yas pa'i bud med kyi 'khor la sogs pa la yongs su longs spyod kyang nyams par mi 'gyur zhing lus de nyid mi 'dor bar bde bar rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i bud med kyi 'khor la sogs pa la yongs su longs spyod kyang nyams par mi 'gyur zhing lus de nyid mi 'dor bar bde bar rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if he enjoys to the full the retinue of infinite women, he will not decline, and will continue to enjoy himself without abandoning that very body.

original: thabs 'di nyid kyis mthar gyis sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi sku'i bar du yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs 'di nyid kyis mthar gyis sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi sku'i bar du yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this very method, he will gradually attain the gnosis body of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: 'khor lo la sogs pa mtshon cha rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du ldong ros dang / mig sman dang / ba bla dang / gi wang dang / gos dang / ku sha dang / nor bu dang / rma bya'i sgro dang / snod @293a *//
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pa mtshon cha rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du ldong ros dang / mig sman dang / ba bla dang / gi wang dang / gos dang / ku sha dang / nor bu dang / rma bya'i sgro dang / snod @293a *//
translated: Just as with weapons such as the discus, so too with ointments, collyrium, bezoar, vermilion, clothes, kuśa grass, jewels, peacock feathers, and vessels.

original: dang / mchil lham dang / gdugs dang / rnga yab dang / rgyal mtshan dang / 'phan dang / padma dang / autpal dang / ta la'i lo ma las ral gri dang; chu gri dang / gri dang / kha tv'am ga la sogs pa'i rdzas su byas pa 'am /🔽lhag mas kyang bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dang / mchil lham dang / gdugs dang / rnga yab dang / rgyal mtshan dang / 'phan dang / padma dang / autpal dang / ta la'i lo ma las ral gri dang; chu gri dang / gri dang / kha tv'am ga la sogs pa'i rdzas su byas pa 'am / lhag mas kyang bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: or with other substances,

original: yid la gang 'dod pa 'am /
analyzed: yid la gang 'dod pa 'am /
translated: whatever one desires,

original: rig sngags dang / gsang sngags dang; rtog pa'i cho ga gzhan la yang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: rig sngags dang / gsang sngags dang; rtog pa'i cho ga gzhan la yang sbyar ba'am /
translated: or with other ritual procedures of knowledge-mantras, secret mantras, and tantras,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po nas gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po nas gsungs pa'i rdzas rnams sam /
translated: or with substances taught in the Tathagata Essence,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po nas gsungs pa'i cho ga 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po nas gsungs pa'i cho ga 'am /
translated: or with ritual procedures taught in the Tathagata Essence,

original: yid la gang 'dod pa'i cho gas kyang sgrub pa byas na de nyid kyis rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid la gang 'dod pa'i cho gas kyang sgrub pa byas na de nyid kyis rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: or with any ritual procedure one desires, if one performs the practice, one will become a knowledge-holder by that very means.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi thad nas dngos grub blang ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi thad nas dngos grub blang ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual for receiving spiritual powers in the presence of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i phyogs gcig du mchod rten dang / sku gzugs dang / dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam mam /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i phyogs gcig du mchod rten dang / sku gzugs dang / dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam mam /
translated: In front of a stūpa, an image, or a book of the sublime Dharma,

original: gang yang rung ba'i mdun du me tog sil ma bkram pa'i dkyil 'khor byas la /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i mdun du me tog sil ma bkram pa'i dkyil 'khor byas la /
translated: or in front of any of them, one should prepare a maṇḍala of loose flowers.

original: ci 'byor pa'i dri dang / me tog dang / phreng ba la sogs pa'i mchod pa byas kyang rung /
analyzed: ci 'byor pa'i dri dang / me tog dang / phreng ba la sogs pa'i mchod pa byas kyang rung /
translated: One should make offerings of whatever one can afford, such as perfume, flowers, garlands, and so forth,🔽or one should not make offerings.

original: ma byas kyang rung; ku sha'i chang bu la nye bar 'dug nas lag pa 'am /
analyzed: ma byas kyang rung; ku sha'i chang bu la nye bar 'dug nas lag pa 'am /
translated: Sitting on a bundle of kuśa grass, one should hold in one’s hand

original: gzhan du yang rung /
analyzed: gzhan du yang rung /
translated: or in another container

original: ldong ros la sogs pa'i rdzas bzung nas /
analyzed: ldong ros la sogs pa'i rdzas bzung nas /
translated: a substance such as red arsenic,

original: lo ma'i bar ram /
analyzed: lo ma'i bar ram /
translated: between two leaves,

original: gos kyi bar du 'am /
analyzed: gos kyi bar du 'am /
translated: or between two pieces of cloth,

original: @293b lcags dang / dngul dang / gser gyi snod du bzhag la ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas na /
analyzed: @293b lcags dang / dngul dang / gser gyi snod du bzhag la ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas na /
translated: or in a vessel of iron, silver, or gold, and recite the mantra until it blazes.

original: de bzhin du bsod nams ji lta ba bzhin rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsod nams ji lta ba bzhin rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, one will become a vidyādhara according to one’s merit.

original: gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “This is called ‘unassailable.’

original: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i cho ga yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i cho ga yin no //
translated: This is the rite of the bodhisattva vehicle that is skilled in means.

original: cho ga 'di nyid kyis dben zhing stong pa'i ri dang / chu klung dang / mtshe'u dang / tshal nyams dga' ba 'am /
analyzed: cho ga 'di nyid kyis dben zhing stong pa'i ri dang / chu klung dang / mtshe'u dang / tshal nyams dga' ba 'am /
translated: By means of this very rite, one should practice in a solitary, empty place, such as a mountain, river, lake, or delightful forest,

original: shing gcig gam /
analyzed: shing gcig gam /
translated: or at a single tree,

original: gtsug lag gi gnas sam /
analyzed: gtsug lag gi gnas sam /
translated: or in a temple,

original: sku gdung dang bcas pa'i mchod rten gyi rtsa 'am /
analyzed: sku gdung dang bcas pa'i mchod rten gyi rtsa 'am /
translated: or at the foot of a stūpa that contains relics,

original: sku gzugs bzhugs pa 'am /
analyzed: sku gzugs bzhugs pa 'am /
translated: or in front of an image,

original: gzhan yang / gtsug lag khang gi brang khang la sogs pa dben par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gtsug lag khang gi brang khang la sogs pa dben par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: or in other solitary places such as the upper or lower rooms of a temple.

original: 'du 'dzi dang bral ba 'am /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi dang bral ba 'am /
translated: One should be free from distractions,

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la goms par byas la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa la goms par byas la /
translated: and cultivate familiarity with the recollection of the Buddha.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: One should have a mind full of love for all sentient beings,

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pa /
translated: be diligent,

original: dad pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa /
translated: have faith,

original: ser sna med pas som nyi dang bral ba'i sems kyis lus dang / srog la yang ltos pa med par bya'o //
analyzed: ser sna med pas som nyi dang bral ba'i sems kyis lus dang / srog la yang ltos pa med par bya'o //
translated: and be free from doubt due to non-stinginess, and one should be unconcerned even with one's body and life.

original: gzhan yang / thams cad kyi thun mong gi cho ga ni ri dang / chu 'gram dang / 'bab chu'i ngos la sogs pa'i gnas dben zhing stong pa rnams su dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam dang / gnyis su gnas la dus gsum du sdig pa bshags pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang / thams cad kyi thun mong gi cho ga ni ri dang / chu 'gram dang / 'bab chu'i ngos la sogs pa'i gnas dben zhing stong pa rnams su dam pa'i chos kyi glegs bam dang / gnyis su gnas la dus gsum du sdig pa bshags pa dang /
translated: Moreover, the rite that is common to all is that in a solitary and empty place, such as a mountain, a riverbank, or a waterfall, one should recite the dhāraṇī in front of a book of the sublime Dharma and two images, confessing one’s sins in the three times,

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs la rjes su yi rang ba byas nas /
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs la rjes su yi rang ba byas nas /
translated: rejoicing in the merit and wisdom of others,

original: @294a *// sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyan sngar gsol ba 'debs pas ci srid mtshan ma byung bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: @294a *// sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyan sngar gsol ba 'debs pas ci srid mtshan ma byung bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: and supplicating in the presence of the buddhas and bodhisattvas until the signs arise.

original: yar ngo'i nya la cho ga snga ma bzhin du nyin zhag gcig smyung bar gnas nas ji skad bstan pa'i rdzas rnams las gang yang rung ba blangs la ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas na de nyid kyis rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yar ngo'i nya la cho ga snga ma bzhin du nyin zhag gcig smyung bar gnas nas ji skad bstan pa'i rdzas rnams las gang yang rung ba blangs la ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas na de nyid kyis rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the full moon of the waxing half, having fasted for one day and one night according to the previous rite, one should take any of the substances that have been taught and recite until it blazes. By that alone one will become a vidyādhara.

original: rig pa mchod don yod pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa /
analyzed: rig pa mchod don yod pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa /
translated: This knowledge-vidya-mantra is naturally accomplished,

original: thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa /
translated: unimpeded,

original: yid la re ba'i phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yid la re ba'i phun sum tshogs pa sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: and fulfills all wishes.

original: ji lta ji ltar rab tu sbyor ba de lta de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rab tu sbyor ba de lta de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever it is applied to, it will be accomplished.🔽Since it is naturally accomplished, it is accomplished by recitation.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa bklags pas 'grub pa yin pas bzlas pa tsam gyis 'dod pa thams cad byed pa yin no //🔽don yod pa'i rtog pa'i cho ga bzhin du sbyar ba 'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa bklags pas 'grub pa yin pas bzlas pa tsam gyis 'dod pa thams cad byed pa yin no // don yod pa'i rtog pa'i cho ga bzhin du sbyar ba 'am /
translated: By merely reciting it, all desires are fulfilled.🔽It should be applied according to the ritual of Amogha-kalpa,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: or it should be accomplished as desired.

original: yang na ras ris bsgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: yang na ras ris bsgrub par 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to accomplish the painting,

original: bcom ldan 'das padma'i gdan la skyil mo krung gis bzhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das padma'i gdan la skyil mo krung gis bzhugs par bya'o //
translated: the Blessed One should be painted seated in the vajra posture on a lotus seat.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas logs su 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje kun nas 'bar bas bskor ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas logs su 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje kun nas 'bar bas bskor ba /
translated: To the right of the Blessed One, Noble Vajrapani should be painted, surrounded by a blazing halo,

original: bcom ldan 'das cod ban las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis mngon par dbang bskur ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das cod ban las byung ba'i 'od zer gyis mngon par dbang bskur ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: and the Blessed One should be painted bestowing empowerment with light rays emanating from his uṣṇīṣa.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yon logs su rig pa'i @294b mchog ces bya ba'i rgyal mo gser gyi mdog can ral pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yon logs su rig pa'i @294b mchog ces bya ba'i rgyal mo gser gyi mdog can ral pa dang bcas pa /
translated: To the left of the Blessed One, the queen called “Supreme Knowledge,” golden in color, with hair,

original: gos gtsang ma bgos pa /
analyzed: gos gtsang ma bgos pa /
translated: wearing clean clothes,

original: padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: seated on a lotus seat,

original: bcom ldan 'das la thal mo sbyar ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la thal mo sbyar ba /
translated: with palms joined in reverence to the Blessed One,

original: 'od kyi phreng bas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: 'od kyi phreng bas brgyan pa'o //
translated: adorned with a garland of light.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma'i 'og tu mtha' med ces bya ba'i 'khor ral gri dang / zhags pa lag na thogs pa /🔽mdog sngo bsangs khros shing 'khrugs pa gos dmar ser zung bgos pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma'i 'og tu mtha' med ces bya ba'i 'khor ral gri dang / zhags pa lag na thogs pa / mdog sngo bsangs khros shing 'khrugs pa gos dmar ser zung bgos pa /
translated: Below the Blessed One, the retinue called “Endless,” holding swords and lassos in their hands,🔽dark blue in color, wrathful and agitated, wearing red and yellow garments,

original: khro gnyer bsdus pa /
analyzed: khro gnyer bsdus pa /
translated: frowning,

original: bgegs thams cad tshar gcod pa /
analyzed: bgegs thams cad tshar gcod pa /
translated: destroying all obstacles,

original: mngag gzhug pa rin po che'i brag la 'dug pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: mngag gzhug pa rin po che'i brag la 'dug pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: standing on a jeweled rock, should be drawn.

original: 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'i 'og tu ni sgrub pa po thal mo sbyar ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'i 'og tu ni sgrub pa po thal mo sbyar ba /
translated: Below Noble Vajrapāṇi, the practitioner with palms joined,

original: rin po che'i brag gi padma'i sdong po la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i brag gi padma'i sdong po la bzhugs pa /
translated: seated on a jeweled rock and lotus stalk,

original: me tog gi 'khri shing gis kun nas bskor ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: me tog gi 'khri shing gis kun nas bskor ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: surrounded by flower vines, should be drawn.

original: de lta bu'i ras ris kyi mdun du cho ga 'dis ji ltar 'dod par ram /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ras ris kyi mdun du cho ga 'dis ji ltar 'dod par ram /
translated: In front of such a painting, one should perform this rite as one wishes,

original: rtog pa gzhan gyi cho ga dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa gzhan gyi cho ga dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: or one may employ another rite from another tantra.

original: rig pa mchog gi ras ris gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa padma dmar po la rab tu bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa mchog gi ras ris gzhan yang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa padma dmar po la rab tu bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: “One should also paint the painting of the supreme knowledge goddess, absorbed in samādhi, seated on a red lotus.

original: de'i 'og tu mngag gzhug pa mtha' med lag pa na ral gri dang / zhags pa thogs pa de dang 'dra bar bri bar bya'o; ;ras ris 'dir yang las de dag kun bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngag gzhug pa mtha' med lag pa na ral gri dang / zhags pa thogs pa de dang 'dra bar bri bar bya'o; ;ras ris 'dir yang las de dag kun bya'o //
translated: “Below her, one should paint an infinite number of messengers, holding swords and nooses, similar to her. In this painting, one should perform all those rites.

original: cho ga gzhan yang ri la sogs pa stong zhing dben pa'i phyogs gcig tu skyil mo krung bcas nas byang chub sems dpa' @295a *//
analyzed: cho ga gzhan yang ri la sogs pa stong zhing dben pa'i phyogs gcig tu skyil mo krung bcas nas byang chub sems dpa' @295a *//
translated: “Another rite: on a mountain, or in an empty, isolated place, one should sit cross-legged, visualize the tathāgatas together with the bodhisattvas,

original: dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs nas mtshan thog thag skyil mo krung ma bshig par bzlas pa byas na sngon du bsten ba ma byas kyang tho rangs sam /
analyzed: dang bcas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs nas mtshan thog thag skyil mo krung ma bshig par bzlas pa byas na sngon du bsten ba ma byas kyang tho rangs sam /
translated: and recite the mantra all night long without breaking the cross-legged posture. Even if one has not previously served the mantra, one will see the knowledge goddess in a dream that very night.

original: nam phyed na rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam phyed na rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: At midnight, one will become a vidyādhara.

original: mthu mtshungs pa med pa dang ldan pas phyir mi ldog pa'i rig pa 'dzin pas mchod par 'gyur /
analyzed: mthu mtshungs pa med pa dang ldan pas phyir mi ldog pa'i rig pa 'dzin pas mchod par 'gyur /
translated: Endowed with unequaled power, one will be worshipped by the irreversible vidyādharas.

original: sems can thams cad kyis mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be worshipped by all sentient beings.

original: rig pa'i mchog 'di gang gi lag tu thob pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa'i mchog 'di gang gi lag tu thob pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever obtains this supreme knowledge will be blessed by all the buddhas.

original: rdo rje'i rigs thams cad kyis yang dag par bsrungs bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs thams cad kyis yang dag par bsrungs bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be truly protected by all the vajra families.

original: sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i sbyor bas lha dang / klu la sogs pa dgug pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i sbyor bas lha dang / klu la sogs pa dgug pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: By the practice of homa and so forth, one can summon gods, nāgas, and so on, and also

original: yid la gang 'dod pa rtog pa gzhan gyi cho ga bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la gang 'dod pa rtog pa gzhan gyi cho ga bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: accomplish whatever one desires in one's mind according to the ritual of other tantras.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i tshig gang yin pa'i dam pa nyis 'gyur du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i tshig gang yin pa'i dam pa nyis 'gyur du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply the words of the essence of the Tathāgata in pairs.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya ba rig pa'i mchog rdzogs so ////
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya ba rig pa'i mchog rdzogs so ////
translated: The supreme knowledge called The Arising of the Tathāgatas is complete.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khor lo rdo rje zhes bya ba sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'khor lo rdo rje zhes bya ba sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul la rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Cakraratna entered the meditative absorption called “the view of the domain of all buddhas.”

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs @295b kyis rdo rje shugs kyi yi ge zhes bya ba byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs @295b kyis rdo rje shugs kyi yi ge zhes bya ba byung bar gyur to //
translated: Then, by the blessing of all the tathāgatas, the syllable of the vajra impulse arose.

original: de las ni rig pa'i mchog gi rdo rje'i tshig 'di byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de las ni rig pa'i mchog gi rdo rje'i tshig 'di byung bar gyur to //
translated: From that, these vajra words of the supreme knowledge arose:

original: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
translated: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas!

original: aom bi ra dzi bi ra dzi mah'a bi ra dzi satva satva /
analyzed: aom bi ra dzi bi ra dzi mah'a bi ra dzi satva satva /
translated: Oṃ viraji viraji mahāviraja satva satva

original: s'a ra te s'a ra te /
analyzed: s'a ra te s'a ra te /
translated: saraṭe saraṭe

original: tr'a yi tr'a yi bi dha ma h'a t'i sam bhanydza ni /
analyzed: tr'a yi tr'a yi bi dha ma h'a t'i sam bhanydza ni /
translated: trāyī trāyī vidha mahāte sambhañjani

original: tarma ti siddha aa gre tram sv'ah'a /
analyzed: tarma ti siddha aa gre tram sv'ah'a /
translated: tarmati siddha agre tam svāhā.

original: 'khor lo rdo rje zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i mchog 'di la yang rig pa'i mchog dang po mi mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa'i rtog pa'i cho gar dang por de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i rtog pa'i cho ga nyis 'gyur du sbyor ba gang yin pa yang nyis 'gyur du 'jug go /
analyzed: 'khor lo rdo rje zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i mchog 'di la yang rig pa'i mchog dang po mi mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa'i rtog pa'i cho gar dang por de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'i rtog pa'i cho ga nyis 'gyur du sbyor ba gang yin pa yang nyis 'gyur du 'jug go /
translated: In this supreme knowledge called “Cakravajra,” in the ritual of the supreme knowledge, the first unequalled and equal, the first double of the essence of the Tathāgatas is applied, and it is doubled.

original: 'di'i ras ris kyi khyad par ni rin po che'i brag las skyes pa'i rin po che'i padma chen po la skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa phyag gis mchog stsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ras ris kyi khyad par ni rin po che'i brag las skyes pa'i rin po che'i padma chen po la skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa phyag gis mchog stsol ba'o //
translated: The special feature of the painting is that he sits in the cross-legged posture on a great jewel lotus born from a jewel rock, bestowing the boon with his hand.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yen logs su rig pa'i mchog phyag na 'khor lo bsnams pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yen logs su rig pa'i mchog phyag na 'khor lo bsnams pa /
translated: Above the Blessed One, the supreme knowledge is Cakravarṣa, holding a wheel in his hand.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: He is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: rin po che'i brag la bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i brag la bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: He should be painted sitting on a jewel rock.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas logs su 'khor lo rdo rje zhes bya ba'i rdo rje 'dzin phyag na 'khor lo bsnams pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas logs su 'khor lo rdo rje zhes bya ba'i rdo rje 'dzin phyag na 'khor lo bsnams pa /
translated: To the right of the Blessed One, Vajradhara called “Cakravajra,” holding a wheel in his hand,

original: cung zad sngo bsangs rin po che'i brag la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: cung zad sngo bsangs rin po che'i brag la bzhugs pa /
translated: [He is] slightly dark blue, seated on a jeweled rock,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyis kun nas bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer gyis kun nas bskor ba'o //
translated: and surrounded by the light of the Tathāgata.

original: de'i 'og logs su sgrub pa po phyag 'tshal ba bri'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og logs su sgrub pa po phyag 'tshal ba bri'o //
translated: Below him, the practitioner should be painted paying homage.

original: lha mo'i 'og tu ni mtha' med ces bya ba 'khor de nyid bgegs tshar gcod pa ral gri dang / zhags pa la @296a *//
analyzed: lha mo'i 'og tu ni mtha' med ces bya ba 'khor de nyid bgegs tshar gcod pa ral gri dang / zhags pa la @296a *//
translated: Below the goddess, [one should paint] Ananta, who is in that very retinue, subduing obstructors, holding a sword and a noose,

original: na thogs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: na thogs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: and wearing a lower garment.

original: ras ris gnyis pa ni lha mo gcig pu gnas pa phyag na 'khor lo bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: ras ris gnyis pa ni lha mo gcig pu gnas pa phyag na 'khor lo bsnams pa'o //
translated: The second painting is of the goddess alone, holding a wheel in her hand.

original: de'i 'og tu ni de bzhin du mtha' med lag na ral gri dang / zhags pa thogs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni de bzhin du mtha' med lag na ral gri dang / zhags pa thogs pa /
translated: Below her, [one should paint] Ananta as before, holding a sword and a noose,

original: khro bo gzhon nu'i gzugs can /
analyzed: khro bo gzhon nu'i gzugs can /
translated: with the form of a wrathful youth,

original: khro gnyer g-yo ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: khro gnyer g-yo ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: frowning and grimacing.

original: 'dir yang cho ga ni snga ma nyid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang cho ga ni snga ma nyid kyis bya'o //
translated: Here too, the rite should be performed as before.

original: ji ltar yid la 'dod pas sam; rtog pa gzhan gyi cho gas kyang bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yid la 'dod pas sam; rtog pa gzhan gyi cho gas kyang bya'o //
translated: One should do it as one wishes, or according to the rite of another tantra.

original: 'dir khyad par ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dir khyad par ni 'di yin no //
translated: Here is the difference:

original: bklags pa tsam gyis dam tshig thams cad shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: bklags pa tsam gyis dam tshig thams cad shes par 'gyur /
translated: By merely reading it, all the samayas will be known.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad du zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad du zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will enter all the maṇḍalas.

original: 'khor lo rdo rje zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i mchog rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'khor lo rdo rje zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i mchog rdzogs so ////
translated: The supreme awareness called “Cakravajra” is complete.

original: de nas bdud rtsi rdo rje zhes bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs kyi stobs kyis dam tshig gi rgyal po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bdud rtsi rdo rje zhes bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs kyi stobs kyis dam tshig gi rgyal po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: Then, the Vajradhara called “Amṛtavajra,” by the power of the blessings of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, entered into the meditative absorption called “the king of samayas.”

analyzed: khyad par @301a *//
translated: The special

original: gyi cho ga phyogs tsam zhig bsdus nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gyi cho ga phyogs tsam zhig bsdus nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: ritual will be summarized and explained.

analyzed: rig pa'i mchog rig pa chen po'i rgyal bo rtse mo 'di ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa /
translated: This supreme knowledge, the king of great knowledge, the peak, is naturally accomplished,

original: bklags pas 'grub pa /
analyzed: bklags pas 'grub pa /
translated: accomplished by recitation,

original: bzlas pa tsam gyis 'dod pa'i don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par byed pa 'di sems can gyi khams rnams rnam par sbyad par bya ba /
analyzed: bzlas pa tsam gyis 'dod pa'i don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par byed pa 'di sems can gyi khams rnams rnam par sbyad par bya ba /
translated: and brings about the perfect fulfillment of desired goals simply through recitation. This is for the purification of the realms of sentient beings,

original: dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas bzlas pa byas na bsrung ba dang / dkyil 'khor dang / bcing ba dang / brdeg pa dang / dbab pa dang / rengs par bya ba dang / bskrad par bya ba dang / dgug pa dang / gdug pa tshar bcad pa dang; bsreg pa dang /
analyzed: dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas bzlas pa byas na bsrung ba dang / dkyil 'khor dang / bcing ba dang / brdeg pa dang / dbab pa dang / rengs par bya ba dang / bskrad par bya ba dang / dgug pa dang / gdug pa tshar bcad pa dang; bsreg pa dang /
translated: One should apply directly the special accomplishment of the extensive activities, such as the protection, the maṇḍala, binding, beating, bringing down, paralyzing, expelling, summoning, destroying the wicked, burning,

original: btso ba dang / mthu bstan pa dang / lha dang / klu la sogs pa dgug pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / don bsgrub par bya ba dang / rgyal po dang / rgyal po'i bu mo dgug cing bsgrub pa dang / bsnyen pa 'phel bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: btso ba dang / mthu bstan pa dang / lha dang / klu la sogs pa dgug pa dang / dbang du bya ba dang / don bsgrub par bya ba dang / rgyal po dang / rgyal po'i bu mo dgug cing bsgrub pa dang / bsnyen pa 'phel bar bya ba dang /
