original: nad rnam par bsal bar bya ba dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin la sogs pa dbang du byed pa la sogs pa las rab 'byams sgrub pa'i khyad par gyis mngon sum du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nad rnam par bsal bar bya ba dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin la sogs pa dbang du byed pa la sogs pa las rab 'byams sgrub pa'i khyad par gyis mngon sum du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: removing illness, controlling nāgas, yakṣas, and so on, and so forth.

original: las gang dang gang sbyin sreg gang dang gang gis de dang / de 'grub pa'i thabs gang yin pa de thabs de de bzhin du las kyi cho gas bya'o //
analyzed: las gang dang gang sbyin sreg gang dang gang gis de dang / de 'grub pa'i thabs gang yin pa de thabs de de bzhin du las kyi cho gas bya'o //
translated: Whatever the rite, whatever the homa, whatever the means of accomplishing that, that means should be performed by the rite of that action.

original: ji ltar nus pa'i brtson 'grus bskyed la mi'i lus ni gdul dka' ba yin zhes smad nas ri'i gseb du zhugs te /
analyzed: ji ltar nus pa'i brtson 'grus bskyed la mi'i lus ni gdul dka' ba yin zhes smad nas ri'i gseb du zhugs te /
translated: Having generated the striving according to one’s ability, having reviled the human body as difficult to tame, one should enter a mountain cave.

original: sdig pa dus gsum du bshags pa dang / bsod nams @301b la rjes su yi rang ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba byas nas nus pa dang mthun par ji srid mtshan ma byung gi bar du bzlas ba bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa dus gsum du bshags pa dang / bsod nams @301b la rjes su yi rang ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba byas nas nus pa dang mthun par ji srid mtshan ma byung gi bar du bzlas ba bya'o //
translated: Having confessed one’s sins in the three times, rejoiced in the merit, and dedicated it, one should recite the mantra according to one’s ability and strength until the signs arise.

original: de nas zla ba nya ba la 'khor lo dang / ral gri dang / gser dang / dngul dang / zangs las byas pa 'am /
analyzed: de nas zla ba nya ba la 'khor lo dang / ral gri dang / gser dang / dngul dang / zangs las byas pa 'am /
translated: Then, on the full moon, one should make a wheel, a sword, or a wheel, sword, and so forth, made of gold, silver, copper,

original: lcags rin po che las byas pa 'am /🔽ta la'i lo ma las byas pa mang rung /
analyzed: lcags rin po che las byas pa 'am / ta la'i lo ma las byas pa mang rung /
translated: iron, or precious substances,🔽or made of palm leaves,

original: ci 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas pa 'am /
analyzed: ci 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas pa 'am /
translated: and make offerings according to one’s means.

original: sngags gang yang rung bas bsrung ba byas te /
analyzed: sngags gang yang rung bas bsrung ba byas te /
translated: Having performed protection with any mantra,

original: ji srid 'bar bar gyur pa'i bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid 'bar bar gyur pa'i bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should recite until it blazes.

original: de nas gang la mtshon gyis brgyab pa de yang 'khor dang bcas par rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar 'khor lo la sogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du mtshon cha thams cad la yang ngo //
analyzed: de nas gang la mtshon gyis brgyab pa de yang 'khor dang bcas par rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro // de ltar 'khor lo la sogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du mtshon cha thams cad la yang ngo //
translated: Then, whoever is struck by the weapon, along with his retinue, will become a vidyādhara.🔽Just as with the wheel, so it is with all weapons.

original: thun mong gi cho gas ba bla 'am /
analyzed: thun mong gi cho gas ba bla 'am /
translated: One should practice with all substances, such as bezoar,

original: ldong ros sam /
analyzed: ldong ros sam /
translated: orpiment,

original: lig bu mig la sogs pa rdzas thams cad la bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: lig bu mig la sogs pa rdzas thams cad la bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: realgar, and so forth, with the common ritual.

original: 'dir sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, there are two types of practice:

original: thabs dang bcas pa dang / thabs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: thabs dang bcas pa dang / thabs dang bral ba'o //
translated: with means and without means.

original: de la cho ga gang yang rung bas zhus pa ji lta ba bzhin du gang yang rung bzhig sems can gyi khams rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur cig ces yid la byas nas bzlas pa byas na myur du dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la cho ga gang yang rung bas zhus pa ji lta ba bzhin du gang yang rung bzhig sems can gyi khams rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur cig ces yid la byas nas bzlas pa byas na myur du dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, having made a request with any suitable ritual, one should recite, thinking, “May this be a cause for the arising of benefit and happiness for all realms of sentient beings,” and one will quickly attain power.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi dngos grub kyi rgyur gyur cig ces yang dag par bsams la bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi dngos grub kyi rgyur gyur cig ces yang dag par bsams la bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should recite the mantra while thinking, “May I become the cause of the spiritual powers of all sentient beings.”

original: de bzhin du sems can gyi khams dge ba la 'jug par gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa @302a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gyi khams dge ba la 'jug par gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa @302a *//
translated: Likewise, one should recite the mantra while thinking, “May the realm of sentient beings engage in virtue,” and so forth.

original: sems can rnams la phan pa'i sbyor ba byas la mos par byas nas bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa'i sbyor ba byas la mos par byas nas bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Having applied oneself to the welfare of sentient beings, one should recite the mantra while visualizing the accomplishment of that.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la dmigs shing phyag 'tshal nas bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la dmigs shing phyag 'tshal nas bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra while visualizing and paying homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis rnams don du gnyer ba la 'bad pas dmigs shing bzlas pa bya zhing sdig pa rnams bshags pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du gnyer ba'i phyir bzla ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis rnams don du gnyer ba la 'bad pas dmigs shing bzlas pa bya zhing sdig pa rnams bshags pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du gnyer ba'i phyir bzla ba dang /
translated: One should recite the mantra while visualizing and striving for the aims of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, confessing one’s vile actions, and striving to perfect all the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa don du gnyer bar dmigs nas bzla ba dang / stobs bcu pa'i ye shes kyi sa non par bya ba don du gnyer bar dmigs nas bzla ba dang / de dag la rjes su yi rang bar byas nas gang yang rung ba'i rig pa mchog gis bsgrubs na myur du dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa don du gnyer bar dmigs nas bzla ba dang / stobs bcu pa'i ye shes kyi sa non par bya ba don du gnyer bar dmigs nas bzla ba dang / de dag la rjes su yi rang bar byas nas gang yang rung ba'i rig pa mchog gis bsgrubs na myur du dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accomplishes any of these supreme awarenesses with rejoicing in them, one will quickly attain power.

original: ri bo'i gseb tu 'bum bzlas pa byas na 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri bo'i gseb tu 'bum bzlas pa byas na 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites one hundred thousand times in a mountain cave, one will see any bodhisattva, such as Ārya Vajrapāṇi.

original: gnyis kyis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams so //
translated: With two, one will see the blessed buddhas.

original: gsum gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: With three, one will speak with the bodhisattvas.

original: bzhis @302b ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhis @302b ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: With four, one will hear the speech of the tathāgatas.

original: ldas ni gzungs rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldas ni gzungs rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By ten, one attains the dhāraṇīs.

original: drug gis nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drug gis nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By six, one can fly through the sky.

original: bdun gyis mngon par shes pa lnga rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdun gyis mngon par shes pa lnga rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By seven, one attains the five superknowledges.

original: brgyad kyis sangs rgyas thams cad la mngon par mchod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgyad kyis sangs rgyas thams cad la mngon par mchod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By eight, one makes offerings to all the buddhas.

original: dgus ni mya ngan las 'das pa mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: dgus ni mya ngan las 'das pa mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: By nine, one accomplishes nirvāṇa.

original: bcus ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su rgyu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcus ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su rgyu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By ten, one roams through the world systems.

original: 'di dag ni thabs la mkhas pa'i bzlas pa'i cho ga ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni thabs la mkhas pa'i bzlas pa'i cho ga ste /
translated: These are the ritual procedures for the recitation of skillful means.

original: mtha' yas pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They become the cause for attaining the infinite result.

original: thabs la mi mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang brtson 'grus rab dang / 'bring dang / tha mas ji ltar bsnyen pa de ltar rab tu sbyar na nub gcig gis rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: thabs la mi mkhas pa rnams kyis kyang brtson 'grus rab dang / 'bring dang / tha mas ji ltar bsnyen pa de ltar rab tu sbyar na nub gcig gis rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Even those who are not skilled in means, if they apply themselves according to their highest, middling, or lowest diligence, will become knowledge-holders in one night, as before.

original: ri 'am / phug gam /
analyzed: ri 'am / phug gam /
translated: On a mountain or in a cave,

original: khang pa'i phug la sogs pa dben zhing stong par me tog dri zhim po sil ma bkram pa /
analyzed: khang pa'i phug la sogs pa dben zhing stong par me tog dri zhim po sil ma bkram pa /
translated: In a secluded and empty place, such as a cave, one should scatter fragrant flowers,🔽and in a place where one has burned fragrant

original: dri zhim pa'i spos kyis bdug pa'i sa phyogs 'ga' zhig tu nyi ma nub pa'i dus na skyil mo krung bcas nas /
analyzed: dri zhim pa'i spos kyis bdug pa'i sa phyogs 'ga' zhig tu nyi ma nub pa'i dus na skyil mo krung bcas nas /
translated: incense, one should sit cross-legged at sunset.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la dmigs pas skyil mo krung ma bshig bar gang yang rung ba'i rig pa'i mchog nam phyed dam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la dmigs pas skyil mo krung ma bshig bar gang yang rung ba'i rig pa'i mchog nam phyed dam /
translated: One should recite the supreme knowledge mantra of any of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, without breaking the cross-legged posture, until midnight,

original: nyi ma shar gyi bar du bzlas pa byas na lus 'bar bar gyur nas gser gyi mdog tu 'gyur /🔽nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / thams cad @303a *//
analyzed: nyi ma shar gyi bar du bzlas pa byas na lus 'bar bar gyur nas gser gyi mdog tu 'gyur / nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / thams cad @303a *//
translated: or until sunrise. If one's body blazes and becomes the color of gold,

original: du 'gro ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du 'gro ba'i rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will become a sky-goer and a knowledge-holder who goes everywhere.

original: gal te ma grub na bar du nub gcig ngal bsos la nub gsum pa la yang de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ma grub na bar du nub gcig ngal bsos la nub gsum pa la yang de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: If one does not accomplish [the feat] in this way, one should rest for one night in the middle, and do the same again for three nights.

original: yang nub gcig gis bar du chod pa'i nub lnga pa la ni dam pa'i chos spong ba yang nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang nub gcig gis bar du chod pa'i nub lnga pa la ni dam pa'i chos spong ba yang nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, on the fifth night, separated by one night, one will certainly accomplish even the abandonment of the true Dharma.

original: bsrung ba'i cho ga byas nas 'bum bzlas te rdzas gang la bsgrubs pa de 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i cho ga byas nas 'bum bzlas te rdzas gang la bsgrubs pa de 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having performed the protection rite, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times. Whatever substance one accomplishes, that will be accomplished.

original: lcags las byas pa'i 'khor lo 'am /
analyzed: lcags las byas pa'i 'khor lo 'am /
translated: One should take in one’s hand a wheel made of iron,

original: rdo rje dang / ral gri la sogs pa lag tu thogs nas ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas te /
analyzed: rdo rje dang / ral gri la sogs pa lag tu thogs nas ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas te /
translated: or a vajra, sword, and so forth, and recite the mantra until it blazes.

original: de nyid kyis rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that alone one will become a knowledge-holder.

original: gal te 'bar bar ma gyur na ba lang gi lci ba'i nang du de bcug la gang yang rung ba'i rig pa mchog gis bsrung ba byas te gzhag go /
analyzed: gal te 'bar bar ma gyur na ba lang gi lci ba'i nang du de bcug la gang yang rung ba'i rig pa mchog gis bsrung ba byas te gzhag go /
translated: If it does not blaze, one should place it in cow dung and, having performed the protection rite with any supreme knowledge mantra, one should leave it there.

original: dur khrod du 'dug nas ji srid gnod sbyin du gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas la mya ngan med kyi shing gi rtsa bar 'dug ste ji srid gnod sbyin mo 'ong bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: dur khrod du 'dug nas ji srid gnod sbyin du gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas la mya ngan med kyi shing gi rtsa bar 'dug ste ji srid gnod sbyin mo 'ong bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having gone to a charnel ground, one should recite the mantra until one becomes a yakṣa. Sitting at the root of an aśoka tree, one should recite the mantra until a yakṣiṇī comes.

original: 'ongs nas ci zhig bgyi zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'ongs nas ci zhig bgyi zhes zer na /
translated: When she comes, she will say, “What can I do?”

original: gang 'dod pa smras na thams cad byed par 'gyur zhing 'khyud nas rang gi khyim du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa smras na thams cad byed par 'gyur zhing 'khyud nas rang gi khyim du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says what one wants, he will do everything.

original: paksha'i shing gi rtsa bar me tog sil ma bkram pa'i dkyil 'khor la lha'i bzhon pa bris la /
analyzed: paksha'i shing gi rtsa bar me tog sil ma bkram pa'i dkyil 'khor la lha'i bzhon pa bris la /
translated: One should draw the celestial vehicle on a maṇḍala of strewn flowers at the root of a pakṣa tree.🔽As long as it blazes, one should recite the mantra.

original: ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas na rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //🔽ri'i gseb tu seng+ge 'am /
analyzed: ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas na rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro // ri'i gseb tu seng+ge 'am /
translated: One will become a vidyādhara.

original: rta bris nas de nyid du 'dug @303b ste; ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: rta bris nas de nyid du 'dug @303b ste; ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should draw a lion or a horse in a mountain cave, and sitting right there, one should recite the mantra as long as it blazes.

original: de bzhin du glang po che dang / ma he dang / lug dang / ra dang / ngang pa dang / rma bya la sogs pa dris nas me tog sil mas brgyan pa'i dkyil 'khor byas nas mtshan mo rangs pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du glang po che dang / ma he dang / lug dang / ra dang / ngang pa dang / rma bya la sogs pa dris nas me tog sil mas brgyan pa'i dkyil 'khor byas nas mtshan mo rangs pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should draw an elephant, a buffalo, a sheep, a goat, a swan, a peacock, and so forth, and having made a maṇḍala adorned with strewn flowers, one should recite the mantra all night.

original: gal te mtshan mo de la ma grub na yang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te mtshan mo de la ma grub na yang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: If it is not accomplished even on that night, one should practice.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran bzhin du lha chen po'i khang par zhugs nas ji srid lha chen po rang gi gzugs kyis 'ong bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran bzhin du lha chen po'i khang par zhugs nas ji srid lha chen po rang gi gzugs kyis 'ong bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: While recollecting the Buddha, one should enter the temple of Maheśvara and recite the mantra until Maheśvara himself comes in his own form.

original: de nas de nyid du nyal na 'ongs nas gang smras pa de byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de nyid du nyal na 'ongs nas gang smras pa de byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, if one sleeps right there, he will come and do whatever he is told.

original: srad med kyi bu'i gzugs brnyan lag tu thogs nas ji srid sred med kyi bu 'ong gi bar du bzlas pa byas nas 'ongs nas gang smra pa de byed par 'gyur ro //🔽lha gang gi khang par bzlas pa'i lha de zla ba phyed kyi nang du nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: srad med kyi bu'i gzugs brnyan lag tu thogs nas ji srid sred med kyi bu 'ong gi bar du bzlas pa byas nas 'ongs nas gang smra pa de byed par 'gyur ro // lha gang gi khang par bzlas pa'i lha de zla ba phyed kyi nang du nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: If one holds a likeness of Nārāyaṇa in one's hand and recites the mantra until Nārāyaṇa comes, he will come and do whatever he is told.

original: yang na bskams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na bskams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The deity whose temple one recites the mantra in will certainly come within half a month, or else he will dry up.

original: yar ngo'i brgyad dam /
analyzed: yar ngo'i brgyad dam /
translated: On the eighth day of the waxing phase,🔽 one should recite the mantra in front of a caitya of the Tathāgata.

original: bcu bzhi la ba bla blangs nas lha chen po'i byang phyogs su ku sha'i changs bu la nye bar 'dug nas ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas na de nas rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ba 'am /🔽mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu bzhi la ba bla blangs nas lha chen po'i byang phyogs su ku sha'i changs bu la nye bar 'dug nas ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas na de nas rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ba 'am / mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having taken hold of the calf of the leg, one should sit near a morsel of kuśa grass to the north of a great god and recite the mantra until he blazes. Then one will become a vidyādhara or become invisible.

original: rnam thos kyi bu bris nas ji srid mdun du 'ongs nas mchog stsol bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu bris nas ji srid mdun du 'ongs nas mchog stsol bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Having drawn Vaiśravaṇa, one should recite the mantra until he comes into one’s presence and grants boons.

original: klu'i gnas mtshe 'u ra ji srid klu rnams gyen du 'phags kyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: klu'i gnas mtshe 'u ra ji srid klu rnams gyen du 'phags kyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: In a nāga dwelling, one should recite the mantra until the nāgas rise up.

original: gal te ldang bar ma gyur na phug ma'i me @304a *//
analyzed: gal te ldang bar ma gyur na phug ma'i me @304a *//
translated: If they do not rise up, one should heat up a pit with a fire of sticks,

original: la lcags kyi snod dam /
analyzed: la lcags kyi snod dam /
translated: and in an iron or copper pot

original: zangs kyi snod til mar gyis bkang nas /
analyzed: zangs kyi snod til mar gyis bkang nas /
translated: filled with oil,

original: ji srid khol bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas nas /
analyzed: ji srid khol bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas nas /
translated: one should recite the mantra until it boils.

original: der klu'i lcug ma tsha dang rang skyur gyis bskus nas bsregs na nges par ldang bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: der klu'i lcug ma tsha dang rang skyur gyis bskus nas bsregs na nges par ldang bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Having anointed a nāga twig with hot ash and sour gruel, if one burns it, they will definitely rise up.

original: dri ma can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ma can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or they will become defiled.

original: 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'i sku gzugs la bltas nas ji srid smra ba dang / 'gul ba dang / 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas na de nas mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'i sku gzugs la bltas nas ji srid smra ba dang / 'gul ba dang / 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas na de nas mchog stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one looks at a statue of Noble Vajrapāṇi and recites the mantra until he speaks, moves, or burns with a flame, then he will grant the supreme attainment.

original: ras ris kyi mdun du me tog gis mngon par brgyan pa'i dkyil 'khor byas nas ji srid du 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje byon gyi bar du bzlas na byon nas mgo la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ras ris kyi mdun du me tog gis mngon par brgyan pa'i dkyil 'khor byas nas ji srid du 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje byon gyi bar du bzlas na byon nas mgo la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes a maṇḍala in front of the painting, adorned with flowers, and recites the mantra until Noble Vajrapāṇi arrives, he will arrive and touch one on the head.

original: reg pa tsam gyis lcang lo can du gnas nas gnod sbyin gyi gzugs su 'gyur ro; ;'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'i rdo rje blangs la ji srid mi snang bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa tsam gyis lcang lo can du gnas nas gnod sbyin gyi gzugs su 'gyur ro; ;'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'i rdo rje blangs la ji srid mi snang bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: By merely being touched, one will dwell in Aṭakāvatī and assume the form of a yakṣa. One should take the vajra of Noble Vajrapāṇi and recite the mantra until he disappears.

original: 'bum bzlas pas las thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bum bzlas pas las thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will be able to perform all activities.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi sku gzugs kyi zhabs kyi mtheb mo la bzung nas ji srid 'bar ba dang / 'phro ba dang / khro ba ston gyi bar du bzlas pa byas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi sku gzugs kyi zhabs kyi mtheb mo la bzung nas ji srid 'bar ba dang / 'phro ba dang / khro ba ston gyi bar du bzlas pa byas na /
translated: Holding it under the big toe of the noble Avalokiteśvara’s foot, one should recite the mantra until he emits light, radiates light, or becomes angry.

original: de nas bya ba thams cad byed par 'gyur zhing gsung bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bya ba thams cad byed par 'gyur zhing gsung bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Then he will do everything one asks and will speak.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la blta zhing ji srid 'bar bar 'gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas @304b na mi snang bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la blta zhing ji srid 'bar bar 'gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas @304b na mi snang bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Looking at noble Mañjuśrī, one should recite the mantra until he emits light.

original: rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become invisible or a knowledge-holder.

original: 'phags pa kun tu bzang po la blta zhing ji srid dge ba la ngoms mi shes pa dang / 'bebs pa dang / mngon par 'phar gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa kun tu bzang po la blta zhing ji srid dge ba la ngoms mi shes pa dang / 'bebs pa dang / mngon par 'phar gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Looking at noble Samantabhadra, one should recite the mantra until one is satisfied with the good qualities, until there is a descent, and until one levitates.

original: rgyud 'dir sngags kyi spyod pa la zhugs pas /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir sngags kyi spyod pa la zhugs pas /
translated: In this tantra, one who has entered the practice of mantra

original: zla ba gzas zin pa'i tshe zangs kyi snod du mar bzhag nas dri zhim po'i me tog gi dkyil 'khor byas te /
analyzed: zla ba gzas zin pa'i tshe zangs kyi snod du mar bzhag nas dri zhim po'i me tog gi dkyil 'khor byas te /
translated: should, at the time of a lunar eclipse, place clarified butter in a copper vessel, make a maṇḍala of fragrant flowers,

original: bdug spos dri zhim pos bdugs la ji srid 'bar bar 'gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas nas de 'thungs na thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdug spos dri zhim pos bdugs la ji srid 'bar bar 'gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa byas nas de 'thungs na thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Fumigate with fragrant incense and recite the mantra until it blazes. If one drinks it, one will retain what one hears.

original: zla ba dang / nyi ma gzas bzung ba na lha chen po'i khang par zhugs nas ldong ros sam /
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi ma gzas bzung ba na lha chen po'i khang par zhugs nas ldong ros sam /
translated: When there is an eclipse of the sun or moon, enter the temple of Maheśvara and take red arsenic,

original: mig sman nam /
analyzed: mig sman nam /
translated: or collyrium,

original: ba bla blangs nas aa shvatta'i 'dab ma'i bar du bcug nas ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas na des rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: ba bla blangs nas aa shvatta'i 'dab ma'i bar du bcug nas ji srid 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas na des rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: or realgar, and place it between the leaves of an aśvattha tree, and recite the mantra until it blazes. By that, one will become a vidyādhara,

original: mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or become invisible.🔽Place one’s hand on the head of Maheśvara and recite the mantra until one becomes invisible.

original: lha chen po'i steng du lag pa bzhag nas ji srid mi snang bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o dur khrod du gnas nas ji srid mi snang bar 'gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: lha chen po'i steng du lag pa bzhag nas ji srid mi snang bar gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o dur khrod du gnas nas ji srid mi snang bar 'gyur gyi bar du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Dwelling in a charnel ground, recite the mantra until one becomes invisible.

original: dur khrod du dkyil 'khor byas nas kham phor ma bsregs pa kha sbyar thal bas bkang nas du ba byung gi bar du bzlas pa byas la de chu gsum byas nas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dur khrod du dkyil 'khor byas nas kham phor ma bsregs pa kha sbyar thal bas bkang nas du ba byung gi bar du bzlas pa byas la de chu gsum byas nas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having made a maṇḍala in a charnel ground, one should fill an unfired clay pot with ash, and recite the mantra until smoke appears. Having made it into three parts, one will become invisible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dgug pa dang / lha dang / klu dgug pa ni nub gcig gis 'grub par 'gyur @305a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dgug pa dang / lha dang / klu dgug pa ni nub gcig gis 'grub par 'gyur @305a *//
translated: One will summon a bodhisattva, or summon a god or a nāga.

original: ro; ;mdor bsdus na rig pa mchog 'di dag gis ni 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ro; ;mdor bsdus na rig pa mchog 'di dag gis ni 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa byed pa yin no //
translated: In short, these supreme vidyās bring about the fulfillment of desires.

original: yid la gang 'dod pa'i cho gas ji ltar bsgrubs pa de de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes mkhas pas brtags la /
analyzed: yid la gang 'dod pa'i cho gas ji ltar bsgrubs pa de de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes mkhas pas brtags la /
translated: Whatever is accomplished through the rite as desired, that will be accomplished.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pas som nyi mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pas som nyi mi bya'o //
translated: The followers of the Bodhisattva Vehicle should not doubt this.

original: de nas 'di'i thun mong gi ras ris bstan par bya ste; bcom ldan 'das rin po che'i padma la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'di'i thun mong gi ras ris bstan par bya ste; bcom ldan 'das rin po che'i padma la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: “Next, I will teach the common painting procedure: The Blessed One is seated on a jeweled lotus.

original: g-yas su ni 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: g-yas su ni 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: To his right is Noble Vajrapāṇi,

original: lha mo rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: lha mo rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: The goddess is adorned with all ornaments,

original: ral pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: ral pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with hair and topknot,

original: gser gyi mdog can thams cad rig pa'i mchog ces bya ba 'am /
analyzed: gser gyi mdog can thams cad rig pa'i mchog ces bya ba 'am /
translated: golden in color, and called “Supreme Awareness” or🔽“Stainless Victorious Splendor.”

original: dri ma med par rnam par gnon pa'i gzi brjid ces bya ba yang rung 'di lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das ma 'od kyi phreng ba dang bcas pa bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: dri ma med par rnam par gnon pa'i gzi brjid ces bya ba yang rung 'di lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das ma 'od kyi phreng ba dang bcas pa bri bar bya ste /
translated: The Blessed Lady is drawn with a halo of light,

original: brag la gnas pa'i padma'i sdong bu la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: brag la gnas pa'i padma'i sdong bu la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: seated on a lotus stalk growing from a rock.🔽Below the goddess, in the same way, is drawn Anantamukhanirhāradhāraṇī,

original: lha mo'i 'og tu ni de bzhin du bgegs thams cad tshar gcod pa'i g-yog mo mtha' yas zhes bya ba bri'o //
analyzed: lha mo'i 'og tu ni de bzhin du bgegs thams cad tshar gcod pa'i g-yog mo mtha' yas zhes bya ba bri'o //
translated: who subdues all obstacles.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i 'og tu ni sgrub pa po phyag 'tshal ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i 'og tu ni sgrub pa po phyag 'tshal ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: Below Vajrapāṇi, the practitioner is drawn paying homage.

original: yang na ras ris ni ji ltar 'dod pa de lta bu bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na ras ris ni ji ltar 'dod pa de lta bu bri bar bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, the painting should be drawn as desired,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku ni mtha' yas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku ni mtha' yas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the form bodies of the Blessed Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are infinite.

original: rtog pa dang ldan zhing thabs la @305b mkhas pa rnams kyis ni ras ris kyi cho ga med pa 'am /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan zhing thabs la @305b mkhas pa rnams kyis ni ras ris kyi cho ga med pa 'am /
translated: Those who are endowed with imagination and skillful means will succeed even without the ritual of the painting

original: mchod pa med par yang 'grub bo //
analyzed: mchod pa med par yang 'grub bo //
translated: or the offerings.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgor spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rig pa mchog gi rgyal po bsdus pa'i le'u rab 'byams rdzogs so ////🔽de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje bstan pa don yod pa'i dngos grub rab tu 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul rgya mtsho nam mkha'i spyan zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i rgyal
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgor spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rig pa mchog gi rgyal po bsdus pa'i le'u rab 'byams rdzogs so //// de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje bstan pa don yod pa'i dngos grub rab tu 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul rgya mtsho nam mkha'i spyan zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i rgyal
translated: The chapter of the compendium of the king of pristine consciousnesses of the bodhisattva conduct of the gateway of secret mantra is complete.

original: mo rtse mos gsol ba btab bo //
analyzed: mo rtse mos gsol ba btab bo //
translated: Then, in order to manifest the accomplishment of the secret lord Vajrapāṇi, in the presence of the Bhagavān, he supplicated with the peak of the knowledge queen of mantra called the ocean of the field of activity of all tathāgatas, the eye of space.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gcig tu rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gcig tu rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
translated: Then the Bhagavān entered into equipoise on the samādhi called the single-minded approach of all tathāgatas.

original: nam mkha'i spyan zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i rgyal mo rtse mo mchog 'di sku thams cad las gsungs so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i spyan zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i rgyal mo rtse mo mchog 'di sku thams cad las gsungs so //
translated: This queen of knowledge, the supreme peak called “the eye of the sky,” was taught by all the bodies.

original: na ma: stree ya dhvi k'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma: stree ya dhvi k'a n'am/
translated: This queen of knowledge, the supreme peak called “Eye of the Sky,” was taught by all the bodies.🔽Homage to the two Tathāgatas,

original: sarba ta th'a ga t'a n'am/
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga t'a n'am/
translated: to all the Tathāgatas!

original: aom ga ga na lo tsa ne /
analyzed: aom ga ga na lo tsa ne /
translated: Oṃ, Gaganalocanā,

original: ga ga na sa ma /
analyzed: ga ga na sa ma /
translated: Gaganasaṃ,

original: sarba th'a aom ga t'a ti sa ra sam bha badzr'a l'a na mo aa mo gh'a n'am sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sarba th'a aom ga t'a ti sa ra sam bha badzr'a l'a na mo aa mo gh'a n'am sv'ah'a /
translated: Sarvatathāgatātītasarasambhavavajralocanāmoghānāṃ svāhā!

original: lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje /
translated: Vajrapāṇi,

original: rig pa'i rgyal mo rtse mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul las yang dag par byung ba /
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal mo rtse mo 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul las yang dag par byung ba /
translated: this peak of the queen of knowledge has arisen from the domain of all the Tathāgatas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bskyed pa'i yum /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bskyed pa'i yum /
translated: is the mother who gives birth to all bodhisattvas,

original: mtha' yas pa thogs pa med pa don yod par grub pa /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa thogs pa med pa don yod par grub pa /
translated: is infinite, unobstructed, and unfailing,

original: sngags kyi spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa la rab tu sbyor bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa la rab tu sbyor bar gnas pa'o //
translated: and is applied to the activity of the buddhas for the bodhisattvas who practice mantra.

original: 'di @306a *// 'dzin par byed pa'i rigs kyi bu ni phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di @306a *// 'dzin par byed pa'i rigs kyi bu ni phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The son of good family who upholds this will be irreversible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be blessed by all the tathāgatas.

original: bzlas pa nyid kyis yon tan mtha' yas pa mnyam pa med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa nyid kyis yon tan mtha' yas pa mnyam pa med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the recitation alone, one will attain infinite, incomparable qualities.

original: bsgrub pa byas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub pa byas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs the practice, one will be blessed by all the tathāgatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sa la 'jug pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sa la 'jug pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain entry into the bodhisattva levels.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin mi 'phrogs pa don yod pa 'dis tshegs chung dus thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub rnams ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin mi 'phrogs pa don yod pa 'dis tshegs chung dus thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain the powers of a knowledge-holder and so forth, as one wishes, without fail, and one will obtain them with little difficulty.

original: de nas da ni rig pa 'dzin pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i rtog pa'i cho ga phyogs tsam zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas da ni rig pa 'dzin pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i rtog pa'i cho ga phyogs tsam zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, the ritual of the rite of the cause of attaining a knowledge-holder will be explained in brief.

original: sems bskyed pa'i rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpas tshes gcig nas brtsams nas dang por zhig sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag nyid dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpas tshes gcig nas brtsams nas dang por zhig sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag nyid dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, the son of good family who has generated the Thought, should first of all, beginning on the first day of the bright half of the month, offer himself to all the Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: dbul ba'i tshig 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dbul ba'i tshig 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: He should utter the words of the offering:

original: bdag che ge mo zhes bgyi ba sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad la bdag dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag che ge mo zhes bgyi ba sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad la bdag dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: “I, named so-and-so, offer myself to all the Buddhas and bodhisattvas together with their retinues.

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa de dag thams cad kyis dus thams cad du sdug bsngal ba bdag la byin gyis brlab tu gsol /🔽yongs su bzung du gsol /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa de dag thams cad kyis dus thams cad du sdug bsngal ba bdag la byin gyis brlab tu gsol / yongs su bzung du gsol /
translated: May all of them, endowed with great compassion, always bless me with suffering.🔽May they accept me.

original: yongs su bskyab tu gsol @306b zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yongs su bskyab tu gsol @306b zhes brjod do //
translated: May they protect me.”

original: de nas sdig pa bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sdig pa bshags par bya ste /
translated: Then he should confess his evil deeds:

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thugs bskyed pa gang gis bshags pa'i sems bskyed pa des dus thams cad pa'i sdig pa thams cad bdag gis kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa de bzhin du bshags par bgyi'o zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thugs bskyed pa gang gis bshags pa'i sems bskyed pa des dus thams cad pa'i sdig pa thams cad bdag gis kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa de bzhin du bshags par bgyi'o zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: I too confess all my evil deeds committed throughout time in the same way that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and the Bodhisattvas confess them with the attitude that gives rise to the Awakening Mind.

original: nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du bshags par bya'o //
translated: Or else, I confess them in accordance with my ability.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa sems can thams cad kyi khams rnam par sbyong bar byed pa'i dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs rnams la rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa sems can thams cad kyi khams rnam par sbyong bar byed pa'i dus gsum du gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs rnams la rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: I rejoice in the merit and wisdom accumulations of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the three times, who purify the realms of all sentient beings, and who are the cause of the happiness and benefit of all sentient beings.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mkhyen pa de bzhin du rjes su yi rang zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mkhyen pa de bzhin du rjes su yi rang zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: I rejoice in the same way that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, rejoice.

original: nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nus pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
translated: I rejoice in all of them just as they are.

original: de nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa na /
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa na /
translated: Then, in all the world systems,

original: bdag gi med pa /
analyzed: bdag gi med pa /
translated: without any sense of ownership,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa /
translated: without any possessiveness,

original: thang dang / chu las skyes pa'i rin po che'i ri dang / rgya mtsho'i rin po che la sogs pas mchod pa'i thabs la goms par byas la /
analyzed: thang dang / chu las skyes pa'i rin po che'i ri dang / rgya mtsho'i rin po che la sogs pas mchod pa'i thabs la goms par byas la /
translated: I imagine that I offer the means of worship with the jewels of the mountains and oceans, and with the jewels that grow on land and in water.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad la dbul zhing yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'khor dang bcas pa thams cad la dbul zhing yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: I offer them to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, together with their retinues, and I dedicate them.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang / @307a *//
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang / @307a *//
translated: Then, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du rgya che zhing gya nom pa mchod pa'i sprin rab 'byams rnams bdag gi smon lam dang / bsod nams kyi stobs dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis so sor 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du rgya che zhing gya nom pa mchod pa'i sprin rab 'byams rnams bdag gi smon lam dang / bsod nams kyi stobs dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs kyis so sor 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod la /
translated: May the clouds of offerings, vast and sublime, arise individually through the power of my aspirations and merit, and through the blessings of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de lta bu'i mchod pa chen po mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i rig pa'i rgyal mo chen mo 'di yang lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mchod pa chen po mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i rig pa'i rgyal mo chen mo 'di yang lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
translated: And one should recite this queen of knowledge mantras, which accomplishes such great offerings, eight times.

original: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satva n'am/
analyzed: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satva n'am/
translated: Namaḥ sarva buddhābodhisatvanām.

original: sarba th'a aung+ga te spha ra na hi mam/
analyzed: sarba th'a aung+ga te spha ra na hi mam/
translated: Sarva tathāgatā te spharaṇa himaṃ.

original: ga ga na kham sa mant'a te sv'ah'a /
analyzed: ga ga na kham sa mant'a te sv'ah'a /
translated: Gagana khaṃ samantāt te svāhā.

original: de nas gzhan ma yin par mchod pa rnams de bzhin du yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gzhan ma yin par mchod pa rnams de bzhin du yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the offerings that are not different from those will arise in the same way.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yon tan bsngags pa rgya mtsho sgrogs pa'i dbyangs rab 'byams rnams kyis sems can gyi khams thams cad dang / chos kyi dbyings su grags pa 'jug par gyur cig /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la yon tan bsngags pa rgya mtsho sgrogs pa'i dbyangs rab 'byams rnams kyis sems can gyi khams thams cad dang / chos kyi dbyings su grags pa 'jug par gyur cig /
translated: Then, may the infinite melodies of the ocean of praises of the qualities of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas resound in all the realms of sentient beings and in the realm of phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rjes su 'jug par gyur cig /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rjes su 'jug par gyur cig /
translated: May the Dharma wheel of all the tathāgatas be set in motion.

original: mdo sde'i tshul rab tu sgrogs par gyur cig ces bsams la /🔽bstod pa dang / bsngags pa sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: mdo sde'i tshul rab tu sgrogs par gyur cig ces bsams la / bstod pa dang / bsngags pa sgrub par byed pa /
translated: May the way of the sūtras be proclaimed.🔽Thinking thus, one should recite this great queen of knowledge mantras, which brings about praise and extols the qualities,

original: chos thams cad kyi sprin gyi char 'bebs par byed pa'i rig pa chen mo'i rgyal mo 'di yang @307b lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sprin gyi char 'bebs par byed pa'i rig pa chen mo'i rgyal mo 'di yang @307b lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
translated: and which causes the rain of clouds of all Dharma to fall, eight times.

original: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
translated: Namo sarva buddhābodhisattvānāṃ

original: sarba tra sam ku su mi t'a /
analyzed: sarba tra sam ku su mi t'a /
translated: sarvatra saṃkusumite

original: aa bhi dzny'a na r'a shi n'i na mo stu te sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aa bhi dzny'a na r'a shi n'i na mo stu te sv'ah'a /
translated: abhijñā rāśi namo’stu te svāhā.

original: de nas de bzhin du gzhan ma yin par bstod pa brjod pa dang / chos brjod pa'i dbyangs rnams sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa bzhin du nges par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du gzhan ma yin par bstod pa brjod pa dang / chos brjod pa'i dbyangs rnams sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji ltar mkhyen pa bzhin du nges par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, in the same way, the praises and the melodies of the Dharma will be definitely present just as they are known by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad zhi bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad zhi bar byed pa /
translated: May it pacify all the sufferings of all beings.🔽May it be the means of attaining the concentration of the wish to benefit and bring happiness to all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam gtan la ched du byed pa'i dmigs pa thams cad kyis ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs kyi mtshan mas brtags pa'i spyod lam ston cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam gtan la ched du byed pa'i dmigs pa thams cad kyis ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs kyi mtshan mas brtags pa'i spyod lam ston cing /
translated: May it be the means of displaying the conduct of the various samadhis, which are marked by the various signs of samadhi.🔽May it be the means of emanating various clouds of emanations, which pervade the dharmadhatu, and which face all sentient beings.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa'i sprin 'byung ba chos kyi dbyings su spros pas sems can thams cad la mngon du phyogs pas gnas pa dang / stobs bcu'i ye shes kyi sa la sems can rnams rab tu dgod pa'i bar du gyur cig ces tshig tu brjod pa 'am /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa'i sprin 'byung ba chos kyi dbyings su spros pas sems can thams cad la mngon du phyogs pas gnas pa dang / stobs bcu'i ye shes kyi sa la sems can rnams rab tu dgod pa'i bar du gyur cig ces tshig tu brjod pa 'am /
translated: May it be the means of establishing all sentient beings in the wisdom of the ten powers.

original: bsams la de lta bu'i sprul pa chen po mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i rig pa'i rgyal mo chen po 'di lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsams la de lta bu'i sprul pa chen po mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i rig pa'i rgyal mo chen po 'di lan brgyad kyi bar du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having contemplated in this way, one should recite this queen of knowledge that accomplishes such a great emanation eight times.

original: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
translated: Namaḥ sarva buddhānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ ca

original: na mo stu te /
analyzed: na mo stu te /
translated: Namaḥ stute

original: mah'a badzra sarba s'a dha hi tam ka ra /
analyzed: mah'a badzra sarba s'a dha hi tam ka ra /
translated: Mahāvajra sarva sādhana hitamkara

original: tishtha sard'a tra sarbbe sh'am dharm'a n'am/
analyzed: tishtha sard'a tra sarbbe sh'am dharm'a n'am/
translated: Tiṣṭha sarvatra sarveṣāṃ dharmāṇām

original: aa dhishtha ya sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aa dhishtha ya sv'ah'a /
translated: Adhiṣṭhāya svāhā

original: de nas ji ltar mngon par bsgrubs pa de dag ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas ji ltar mngon par bsgrubs pa de dag ji lta ba bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, whatever has been accomplished will remain just as it is.

original: rig pa @308a *//
analyzed: rig pa @308a *//
translated: This knowledge

original: 'di kun yang gong du ci tsam 'dod pa'i bzlas pa byas na gsang sngags kyi spyod pa yang dag par grub pa rnams la sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di kun yang gong du ci tsam 'dod pa'i bzlas pa byas na gsang sngags kyi spyod pa yang dag par grub pa rnams la sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: mantra should be recited as much as desired above. Then the buddhas and bodhisattvas will see the one who has accomplished the practice of the secret mantra just as it is.

original: des de ltar sems can gyi don dang / dgos pa bdag gir byas nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: des de ltar sems can gyi don dang / dgos pa bdag gir byas nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Having thus taken up the welfare of sentient beings and the purpose of oneself, one should rejoice in the accomplishment of the aims of all sentient beings by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, beginning with the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment and continuing until the attainment of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub kyi bar gyi sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrubs pa la rjes su yi rang zhing dmigs pa la goms par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal ba 'am /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub kyi bar gyi sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrubs pa la rjes su yi rang zhing dmigs pa la goms par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal ba 'am /
translated: Having become accustomed to the meditation on the object, one should pay homage to all the Tathagatas.

original: dmigs pa la goms par byas te /
analyzed: dmigs pa la goms par byas te /
translated: Having become accustomed to the meditation on the object,

original: 'dir yang nam mkha'i spyan bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang nam mkha'i spyan bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: here one should recite the Akashagarbha Confession.

original: yang na sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyis rlabs kyi stobs dang / bdag gi bsod nams kyi stobs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyan rnams ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis rlob cing 'byung bar gyur cig ces dang po yid la byas la bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyis rlabs kyi stobs dang / bdag gi bsod nams kyi stobs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi spyan rnams ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis rlob cing 'byung bar gyur cig ces dang po yid la byas la bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Or else, “By the power of the blessing of the Tathāgatas, and by the power of my own merit, may the eyes of the Tathāgatas arise in the world, as is fitting, blessed by the Tathāgatas.”

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa'i sems can thams cad kyi don 'byung ba'i dngos grub thob par gyur cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pas bsngags pa'i sems can thams cad kyi don 'byung ba'i dngos grub thob par gyur cig ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, “May I attain the power to bring about the welfare of all beings, praised by the Tathāgatas.”

original: yang na sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs @308b pa'i ye shes kyi mig dang ldan par gyur cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs @308b pa'i ye shes kyi mig dang ldan par gyur cig ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, “May all beings come to have the eye of the wisdom of the Tathāgatas.”

original: yang na dge ba la 'bad pa 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dge ba la 'bad pa 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, “May they come to strive for virtue.”

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, “May they come to be the cause of the wisdom of the Tathāgatas.”

original: yang na stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs pas bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa 'am /
analyzed: yang na stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs pas bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa 'am /
translated: Or else, may they be perfected by the completion of the ten powers, the perfection of the accumulations of merit and wisdom,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa 'am /
translated: the perfection of the wisdom body of the Tathagata,

original: mtshan dang / dpe byad dang ldan pa'i sku yongs su rdzogs pa 'am /
analyzed: mtshan dang / dpe byad dang ldan pa'i sku yongs su rdzogs pa 'am /
translated: the perfection of the body endowed with the major and minor marks,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo chen po skor ba'i sku yongs su rdzogs pa sems can thams cad kyis so sor thob par gyur cig ces bya ba 'am /🔽yang na sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang yang dag par 'grogs shing /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo chen po skor ba'i sku yongs su rdzogs pa sems can thams cad kyis so sor thob par gyur cig ces bya ba 'am / yang na sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang yang dag par 'grogs shing /
translated: the perfection of the body that turns the great wheel of the Dharma, and may all sentient beings attain it.🔽Or else, may they be perfected by the company of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa yang dag par sgrub pa 'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa yang dag par sgrub pa 'am /
translated: and by the accomplishment of the deeds of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis rnams rim gyis gnon pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis rnams rim gyis gnon pa'i phyir ram /
translated: in order to gradually ascend to the stages of all buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'jug pa 'am //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'jug pa 'am //
translated: in order to enter the entire maṇḍala of the conduct of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra,

original: gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa thams cad so sor thob pa 'am /
analyzed: gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa thams cad so sor thob pa 'am /
translated: in order to attain each of all the dhāraṇīs, samādhis, and liberations,

original: mchod pa chen po'i sprin mngon par bsgrub pa sprul pa 'am /🔽de bzhin gshegs @309a *//
analyzed: mchod pa chen po'i sprin mngon par bsgrub pa sprul pa 'am / de bzhin gshegs @309a *//
translated: in order to emanate the accomplishment of the great clouds of offerings,

original: pa thams cad kyi sprin las chos kyi char gyi rgyun 'bab pa rab tu gnas par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: pa thams cad kyi sprin las chos kyi char gyi rgyun 'bab pa rab tu gnas par bya ba 'am /
translated: in order to establish the rain of the Dharma to fall from the clouds of all the tathāgatas,

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi bcad pa 'am /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi bcad pa 'am /
translated: in order to ensure the continuity of the lineage of the Three Jewels,

original: rig pa 'dzin pa'i dpal thob par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i dpal thob par bya ba 'am /
translated: in order to attain the glory of the knowledge holders,🔽and

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid rab tu thob pa yang sems can thams cad la 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod do //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid rab tu thob pa yang sems can thams cad la 'byung bar gyur cig ces brjod do //
translated: May the attainment of the state of a vajra-holder arise for all sentient beings.

original: yang na bsam pa ji lta ba dang; mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'am /
analyzed: yang na bsam pa ji lta ba dang; mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'am /
translated: Or, according to one's intention and devotion,

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba 'byung ba'i bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba 'byung ba'i bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: one should recite with the intention and superior intention that the welfare and happiness of all realms of sentient beings may arise.

original: yang na bla na med pa'i dngos grub thams cad bdag gi smon lam gyi stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs kyis sems can thams cad la 'byung bar gyur cig ces sam /
analyzed: yang na bla na med pa'i dngos grub thams cad bdag gi smon lam gyi stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs kyis sems can thams cad la 'byung bar gyur cig ces sam /
translated: Or, May all unsurpassed accomplishments arise for all sentient beings by the power of my aspiration and the blessings of the Tathāgatas,

original: ji ltar rigs par sems kyis bsams la bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par sems kyis bsams la bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: or whatever is appropriate, one should recite with a focused mind.

original: de ltar goms par bzlas pa byas na dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar goms par bzlas pa byas na dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting in this way, one will attain accomplishment.

original: smon lam dang rjes su mthun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang rjes su mthun par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mngon par phyogs shing 'jug na nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon lam dang rjes su mthun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang rjes su mthun par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mngon par phyogs shing 'jug na nges par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one turns toward and engages in the bodhisattva conduct in accordance with the aspirations and in accordance with the effort, one will certainly succeed.

original: 'di dag ni rtag tu bya ba'i cho ga yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rtag tu bya ba'i cho ga yin no //
translated: These are the rules for constant practice.

original: yang na som nyi med pa'i dad pas ci ltar nus pa'i cho gas bya'o //
analyzed: yang na som nyi med pa'i dad pas ci ltar nus pa'i cho gas bya'o //
translated: Or else, with unwavering faith, one should do it according to the rules as much as one can.

original: de nas 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi @309b glegs bam mam /
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi @309b glegs bam mam /
translated: Then one should recite the Dharma texts such as the noble Gandavyūha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya che ba'i lugs rgyas par byed pa'i mdo sde gdon par bya /🔽mchod par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya che ba'i lugs rgyas par byed pa'i mdo sde gdon par bya / mchod par bya ba 'am /
translated: or the sūtras that expand the system of the vast bodhisattva conduct.🔽One should make offerings

original: tha na phyag byas nas so //
analyzed: tha na phyag byas nas so //
translated: or at least pay homage.

original: kun nas ngal bar gyur nas zas zan sngags 'dis zas la lan brgyad mngon par bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas ngal bar gyur nas zas zan sngags 'dis zas la lan brgyad mngon par bzlas par bya'o //
translated: When one is completely tired, one should eat food that has been enchanted eight times with this mantra:

original: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma: sarba buddha bo dhi satv'a n'am/
translated: Namo sarva buddhābodhisatvānāṃ |

original: aom ba lim da de te dzo m'a li ni sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom ba lim da de te dzo m'a li ni sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ baliṃ te dīpyamānalimalni svāhā.

original: de nas zas kyis dub pa bsal la phyi dro'i dus su yang snga dro'i cho ga 'di nyid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zas kyis dub pa bsal la phyi dro'i dus su yang snga dro'i cho ga 'di nyid kyis bya'o //
translated: Then, having dispelled the fatigue of the meal, one should perform the same rite in the evening as in the morning.

original: skyo bar gyur na sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: skyo bar gyur na sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: When one becomes weary, one should recite the mantra.

original: ji srid mi skyo ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid mi skyo ba'i bar du'o //
translated: One should do this as long as one does not become weary.

original: de nas smon lam btab nas ldang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas smon lam btab nas ldang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having made aspirations, one should rise.

original: langs nas zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde klog pa la sogs pa gzhan bya'o //
analyzed: langs nas zab cing rgya che ba'i mdo sde klog pa la sogs pa gzhan bya'o //
